Jobs.Title: Associate Finance Analyst
Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
FPNA team is a focal point in Maersk for management reporting, forecasting, budgeting, financial planning, performance management. deep dive analysis and finance related business support.

Associate Finance Analyst will help drive financial performance in an organisational area
by assisting with guidance and support on financial information, business performance and implementation of strategies.

The role will also be required to manage business from its basic accounting entry to analytical process upto sophisticated financial reporting. We require people with career development-oriented to join this profession

In FPNA, this role will work together with a pool of highly skilled and talented people in an international environment, getting empowerment and great responsibilities as well as senior management exposure

Key Responsibilities

Our FPNA team acts as the financial sparring partners to Business Stakeholders.

  • Reporting to the Senior Financial Planning Manager and interacting with multiple stakeholders within Maersk Liner Business as well as Maersk Group.

  • As Financial Analyst you will provide analytical insight and improvement scenarios to Business Stakeholders on profitability (on GP and EBIT Level) & Business performance against target.

  • Other key tasks:

  • Track performance against targets for assigned Product/Customer Vertical/Segment.

  • Responsible for execution, planning and design of forecasting processes.

  • To support the decision-making process by providing value-add analysis, financial management information, deep dive analysis, board reports, performance management

  • Reporting and financial planning. The financial analysis must be supported by efficient and clear communication to stakeholders and decision makers.

  • Be Sparing Partner to Business leads and the link between the Business heads and the Finance organization, as well as liaising with Regional FBPs

The role will need to work with all levels of our organization which requires a clear understanding of the level of quality and commitment required to meet ambitious targets and constantly improve our business and financial processes.

The financial analysis must be supported by efficient and clear communication to stakeholders and decision makers.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Has a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Economics or is Chartered Accountant

  • The candidate has prior experience (minimum 5 years post qualification experience) within a business partnering environment, working as part of a business leadership team or in a consulting firm

Furthermore you -

  • Are highly skilled in Excel and PowerPoint, while experience from BI systems is a plus

  • Are a strong team player with the ability to engage with and influence, guide and challenge multiple stakeholders

  • Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strong integrity and collaboration mindset that goes well with people at all levels in a global organization. Also proven ability to influence without authority and engage confidently with leaders at all levels.

  • Are used to and enjoy working in a challenging, fast-paced and changing environment dealing with a lot of different tasks at the same time

  • Are result driven and have a strong logical and analytical capacity

Are a self-starter with a strong driving force, striving for continuous improvement, be able to see opportunities and wanting to solve problems even if finding answers are not easy and invite yourself to the table

Oversees, develops and manages operational Logistics activities for a
region or smaller business unit.

We Offer:

An excellent opportunity for the right candidate. You will be exposed to exciting challenges in a rapidly transforming company, a scope to expand your reach with internal and external people network and lasting development opportunities within Maersk.  

You will play a key role in evolving the CL product and get hands on experience in conceptualizing, implementing end-to-end supply chain solutions for customers with exposure to best practices & technology enablers.  Furthermore, you will work in a Great Place To Work in a multi-cultural environment driven by Values, Customer and People Orientation. You will get to focus on creating valuable relations and work with high performing teams in an environment where you will be valued, recognized and rewarded.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for all aspects of leadership, profitability, strategy and execution for Contract Logistics (CL) product in alignment with the Area business plan with an objective of ensuring sustainable and profitable growth within the business strategy & targets
  • Be accountable for the financial and non-financial targets for products in scope.
  • Explore avenues for business growth and modulate as per the current market trends; review & revise the product basket regularly to successfully meet customer implied and express needs
  • Take proactive steps to optimize key business operating variables to maximise efficiencies, throughput and drive cost leadership in CL execution with strong focus on vendor performance management
  • Responsible for health and safety governance and operating governance along with collaborating with relevant functions and other product lines within Maersk
  • Develop and drive profitable expansion of the CL business within targeted locations, client segments and industries.
  • Ensure that business interests are optimised through the maintenance of a network with customers, customs, vendors, suppliers and other statutory authorities to realize business deliverables
  • Liaise, negotiate and finalize Rate contracts with suppliers, vendors and customers with strong performance management, while complying with Maersk's procurement and compliance guidelines
  • Identify and coach talent, reward good performance helping build an CL organisation capable of operating independently through setting clear and measurable targets with appropriate level of empowerment & engagement
  • Resolve escalations and root cause problems with lasting solution. Foster customer intimacy and ensure adequate risk management in place for entire of CL organization

Hard KPIs:

  • Profitability of CL Product and facilities in scope
  • Operational Optimization – cost, productivity & utilization
  • Vendor Audit & Performance Management
  • Outstanding payments

Soft KPIs:

  • Passion for customers and customer intimacy
  • Strategic mindset, Result orientation and execution drive
  • Commercial acumen with analytical and negotiation skills
  • Ability to provide leadership and energize people towards shared vision
  • Ability to influence, collaborate and drive business midst ambiguity
  • Entrepreneurial drive with cost-conscious mindset
  • Stakeholder management & conflict resolution
  • Ability to challenge Status quo

We are looking for:

  • Minimum 15 years’ experience in logistics industry with 10+ years’ experience in managing P&L and leading large teams, solution design experience in contract logistics
  • Solid experience in fulfilment warehousing activities & Omni-channel logistics with rich understanding of warehousing technologies and automation 
  • Experience in overseeing and managing the rollout of new warehouses including both greenfield & brownfield sites
  • Strategic Mindset with demonstrated project management, analytical skills & vendor performance management
  • Experience in cost and productivity optimization through process improvement, as well as design and implementation of new process / systems
  • Understanding of container shipping industry and an ability to relate with allied industries e.g. Auto, Pharma & Chemicals, Retail, FMCG
  • Ability to provide leadership, obtain cooperation to meet objectives, drive engaging team environment
  • Management of customer SLA & QBR, and experience in creating dashboard reporting
  • Post graduate studies in general management / supply chain management
  • Fluent in English, excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Preferably with good networks and connects in logistics industry

Senior Quality Engineer – Cloud Integration

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive. With a dedicated team of over 80,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, A.P. Moller - Maersk is developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other.

The Maersk group operates one of the most comprehensive marine container terminals networks in the world, under the brand of APM Terminals, with over 20,000 employees operating 76 terminals in 36 countries and growing.

APM Terminals (APMT) plays a critical role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transhipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals, into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator.

We are currently looking for a Senior Quality Engineer to join our APM Terminals Terminal Integration Platform team based in Bengaluru.

We offer

As a Software Developer in Test engineer, you will be working in a product team that is responsible for designing, implementing and supporting cloud-native technologies, as well as mentoring and developing other QA engineers within the APMT Hybrid Cloud team (part of APMT Terminal Integration Platform).  You will be a key member of the product team and work closely with the team to deliver innovative solutions that support our business deliverables within a context of cloud-native, open-source technologies, aligned to our modernisation strategy, with a focus on ensuring high quality deliverables.
 

Key Responsibilities

  • Works day to day as part of the product team, implementing solutions, estimating and sizing activities.
  • Supports their solutions in production as part of a DevSecOps methodology. Staying Secure, always available with high quality.
  • Mentors colleagues and other engineers, providing advice and guidance
  • A secure by design attitude – from TLS certificates, OAuth to industry CIS standards – you know how test security from the start, and then stay secure
  • Follows industry trends and the latest technologies both in the wider technology world, as well as our internal communities of practice, bringing experience from other parts of the organization into the team and contributing back.

We are looking for

For us, it is all about you, and how we can build the best career with you in mind. Of course, we have an expectation around what you can bring to the role - but don't expect that you bring all of the things mentioned below. In short, we use a more holistic approach to the evaluation of our potential employees- so get in touch to see how you can be part of this journey!
Of course, you have a successful QA engineering background, and we would love to hear from you if you can demonstrate expertise and technical skills in a cloud native, secure, open-source, containerised environment across most of the following areas;

  • Must have worked in BDD Test Automation Frameworks like Cucumber-JVM, Cucumber, JBhehave, RSpec, etc.
  • Container Orchestration with Kubernetes. Do you know your Deployments from your StatefulSets?
  • GitOps Desired State Methodologies. You are happy working with yaml files and GitOps tooling
  • Good understanding of API technologies like RESTful, SOAPUI, Kafka, etc.
  • Experienced in Framework Management technologies like Maven, Ant or Gradle
  • Experience in working with any one of the following Continuous Integration tools: Jenkins, Hudson, Team City, Bamboo, Anthillpro
  • Good to have some performance testing skills as well
  • Strong understanding of OOPs concepts
  • Must have strong views on Agile TDD/BDD
  • Must be a Good Team Player and be able to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be comfortable in working with any existing Test Automation Framework and be able to contribute towards it’s improvement
  • Must have developed at least one framework from the scratch and should be able to design and develop new Automation Test Frameworks if needs be
  • Good communication skills and experience of working in self-organising dynamic teams 
  • You are practiced in Agile, TDD, BDD methodologies and can work within and advise scrum teams
  • Leveraging services across multiple cloud providers both in the public cloud, and with on-premise installations

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive. The Maersk group operates one of the most comprehensive marine container terminals networks in the world, under the brand of APM Terminals, with over 20,000 employees operating 76 terminals in 36 countries and growing.

APM Terminals (APMT) plays a critical role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transshipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals, into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator.

We are currently looking for a Senior Scrum Master to join our APM Terminals Terminal Integration Platform team based in Bengaluru.

We offer

We are building cross-functional feature teams, each tackling a different problem within our business domain. Scrum is our methodology of choice, and we seek to continuously refine our process to suit our needs.

We strive to empower each team with as much autonomy as possible, but don’t shy away from cross team alignment when it adds value.

Our work culture is collaborative, and we believe that giving everyone a chance to be heard produces the best results. We believe in an environment where each of us takes ownership and responsibility for developing and implementing new ways of working.

Our software solutions are built on open source technologies like Kakfa, Debezium. Our architecture is microservice based and we always aim to use the technologies and cloud services that best suit our needs.

Key responsibilities

As a Scrum Master for one or more teams, you will work in a servant leader capacity. You will be responsible for making sure the team lives by agile values. You will be the guardian of the scrum team. You will facilitate the scrum ceremonies and work to resolve impediments.

You will monitor the scrum process and work to ensure efficiency across the team, pushing for changes that will ensure quality and value for the business outcomes. You will keep the team motivated, coach them, and ensures observance of the definition of done. You ensure the scrum team executes the backlog according to the priorities defined by the Product Owner, deliver on time, and with production-ready quality.

  • Build high-performing and self-organizing teams that deliver business values though agile way of working.
  • Run sprint ceremonies with teams working in different locations across the globe.
  • Build a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on problem solving.
  • Resolve impediments and shield teams from outside distractions and unintended dependencies and interference.
  • Helping the team manage interpersonal conflicts, challenges and opportunities for growth.
  • Support release planning activities, and release and sprint burndown analysis.
  • Facilitate discussions, decision making, and conflict resolution between team members and Product Owners.
  • Communicate with other teams and management on project progress and dependency, ensuring transparency across all stakeholders.
  • Actively participate in Scrum Master communities to share best practices.
  • Have a natural curiosity for gaining business acumen in Container Shipping and Chartering.

We are looking for -

  • A certified Scrum Master, with at least a Bachelor’s degree and proven experience working as a Scrum Master across complex initiatives.
  • A good understanding of technology and software delivery practices.
  • A continual learner who demonstrates the value of learning and knowledge.
  • A strong collaborator, and an excellent communicator, with an ability to articulate the technically complex to be understood by both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Drive a DevOps mindset to lead self-managed teams.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and conflicting priorities.
  • Ability to provide constructive feedback

Jobs.JobDescription:
The Solution Configuration Engineer purpose is to translate pre-sale solution designs into detailed Solution Configuration Design (SCD) at highest value and lowest risk point for the customer and Maersk.
As part of the LL Global and/or Regional product team, the Solution Configuration Engineer is responsible to:
- Develop and architect a detailed solution, including a Solution Configuration Document (SCD), which acts as the detailed aligned bridge between customer, the implementations & CX teams
- The Solution Configuration Engineer’s detailed solution design will be implemented by the Customer, the Maersk LL CIM team and executed by the CX teams

Role Responsibilities:

  • Support the Solution Design Engineer and the Pursuit Team in the later stages of the sales cycle to come up with accurate and feasible high-level solution designs (SDD‘s)
    • Understand and connect customers’ existing business processes, org design and technology landscape to craft the detailed Maersk solution to create measurable business value.
    • Conduct and lead business and technical design workshops around our customers’ complex global Supply Chain processes to create highly scalable and sustainable solutions.
    • Engage in key customer pursuits.
  • Own the creation of agreed and feasible detailed solution configuration designs post-sales as part of the customer implementation (pre-sale if possible/needed)
    • Synthesize customer’s business requirements to create clear and comprehensive use cases, functional design requirements and technical system requirements
    • Adoption of new technologies and digital platform growth.
    • Defining the overall integration architecture between different customer systems and the Maersk platforms in terms of functional data flow (data choreography)
    • Perform fit gap analysis between Maersk LL product functionality and the client’s requirements.
  • Support the Customer Implementation Team during the phases of the implementation all the way up to hypercare
    • As part of our Global Solutions team, you are working with and mentoring experienced colleagues to implement our solutions within customer projects, owning and managing the solution from initial design workshops until the customer signed off on the solution design.
    • Effort analysis and estimate the implementation effort.
    • Critical product support to the dedicated Implementation team who is focused on the rollout of new client solutions in an accurate and efficient onboarding process

  • Lead, Coach, Mentor Solution Configuration Engineer.
    • Be the LLP subject matter expert to support the business as needed with best practices on operational set up and capabilities including interaction and onsite visits with customers.
    • Be a leader on a team of technical and business analysts and engineers, foster a productive team environment, leverage diverse views to encourage innovation, and mentor team members, coach to ensure their success and growth for future.
    • Keep informed on area/ regional / global supply chain solution projects and products in order to provide support as necessary, across international and domestic supply chain management

  • Product Enablement
    • You Support Regional LL Product managers and Solution Engineers for Sales/Pre-Sales engagements for scoping and estimating solutions support.
    • Capture and share knowledge / best practices throughout organization.
    • Liaise with different Stakeholders in shaping the Product Roadmap

Skills Required:

  • Education:
  • Master’s degree from recognized university.
  • Degree in Operations or Supply Chain Management preferred.
  • Bachelor’s in business administration or related field

  • Experience:
  • Minimum of 12+ years of experience in Supply Chain related or SaaS related field in increasingly responsible roles including implementing complex solutions in an enterprise customer environment as a Sr Solution Architect/ Sr Business Analyst / Sr Supply Chain consultant.
  • Previous experience working with Procure to Pay processes, Order to Cash process, Vendor managed inventory, Transportation and logistics or related solutions.
  • Knowledge and understanding of customers’ supply chain processes and systems / software (for example S&OP, SAP, Oracle and / or other ERP platforms).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong understanding of commercial consultative sales process.

  • Behavioural
  • Assertive/decisive and pro-active
  • High sense of urgency & persistence
  • Confidence in dealing with people and building lasting relationships/networks
  • Effective interpersonal and communication skills
  • Passion, initiative, and drive to continuously develop and learn.

  • Project management experience & Training skills will be an advantage.
  • Outstanding verbal, written & presentation skills •
  • Analytical with proficiency in translating complex requirements into tangible solutions
  • Strong financial and Strategic acumen.
  • Be able to work independently, and willing to travel a min of 25% upon business requirements
  • Skills to manage sensitive customers and personalities
  • Ability to work in a matrix organization and influence decision making.

Jobs.JobDescription:
Software Engineer – Consumer Products (APIs and Events)

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive. With a dedicated team of over 80,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, A.P. Moller - Maersk is developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other.

The Maersk group operates one of the most comprehensive marine container terminals networks in the world, under the brand of APM Terminals, with over 20,000 employees operating 76 terminals in 36 countries and growing.


APM Terminals (APMT) plays a critical role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transshipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals, into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator.

We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our APM Terminals Integration Platform Portfolio team - based in Bangalore (India)

We Offer

As part of this exciting growth, we have a vacancy for a Senior Software Engineer, with at least 5 years relational database experience.  There is a preference for cloud native design experience and for OpenSource technologies.  The successful candidate will be working as a key member of an agile team. You will be actively contributing to the development of business features for the organisation embracing frequent delivery, end-to-end solution ownership and lean/agile principles.

The expectation is for you to work closely with the data and present it in a way that is consumable and aligned to ‘operations and ‘commercial’ consumers.  We are looking for someone who is curious, inquisitive, and interested in being a key part of the solutioning of problem statements as part of the Agile team.

The role will involve contributing as part of a cross functional agile team in the design, development and testing of user stories while actively take part in sprint planning, backlog grooming and task estimation. It is expected that you will bring knowledge and a keen ‘thirst’ for further knowledge, as the role involves identifying and implementing leading-edge technology.

Being an exemplar of progressive development behaviours; maximizing collaboration and knowledge sharing through effective pairing on tasks with developers, testers, and DevOps the developer will also been responsible for the creation of POCs / Spike development and active involvement in technology evaluation.

Key Responsibilities

  • Building software in accordance with the Maersk standards and guidelines
  • Responsible for the quality design and implementation (supportable, maintainable, scalable, performant, secure, efficient, and supportable) of data driven applications delivering business value
  • Provide design validation on key technologies
  • Building Data Products in the form of APIs and Derived events in a reusable method
  • Using disparate data sources to deliver complex event driven products with a good understanding of the business through partnering with them.
  • Designing and engineering Data Products that are lean focused, end to end, thinking with a value orientated mindset and considering FinOps, Lean and true MVPs when delivering products
  • Supporting onboarding data from multiple terminals with different cultures and differing levels of technical debt
  • Take part in on-call rotations with the platform consumers (product development teams) and take the lead in preventing incidents and maintaining platform SLAs, through automation and blameless postmortems.
  • Ensuring builds are kept green and the code management strategy (branching) is closely followed.
  • Raising capability and standards within team; pairing on tasks, peer review of team members’ code and constructive feedback for improvement in both the code base and team capability (blame free feedback etc.)
  • Proactive contribution to continual improvements within your team through both active participation in retrospective and from engagement with cross team best-practice communities
  • Advisory to Product Owners to identify and manage risks, debt, issues, and opportunities for technical improvements
  • Supporting the recruitment of (engineers) across the department
  • Technical support during cut-over activities

Who we are looking for

We are looking for candidates with a proven performance track record with the following:

  • Minimum 5 years of experience
  • You should exhibit knowledge of best practices in building APIs and Events
  • Adhering to best SecDevOps practices
  • Working in a manner that drives cost efficiency (FinOps), through removal of waste
  • Driving re-usability through well designed data products
  • Listening to the needs of technical and business stakeholders and interpreting them in partnership with the product owner
  • Identifying areas of innovation in data tools and techniques and recognise appropriate timing for adoption
  • Understand and help teams apply a range of techniques for data profiling. Sourcing data analysis from a complex single source. You can bring multiple data sources together in a conformed model for analysis.
  • Working with OpenSource technology and introducing new technology to solve problems.
  • Demonstrate knowledge and experience of Event Driven capabilities
  • Demonstrates that they are keeping aligned / educated with latest technology and industry trends
  • Real passion for data and technology
  • Extensive experience with database technologies and architecture.
  • Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Experience of working with virtual teams and scrum teams
  • Ability and initiative to see ambiguity as an opportunity and be able to solve problems, innovate and create
  • Demonstrating a customer first mentality (quick to market, understand business outcome), strive to improve product for the customer

Must Have

  • 5+ years of experience of Kafka development
  • 5+ years of experience in developing APIs / Microservices Design & Development
  • Agile software development experience and discipline, preferable with experience of XP or other high collaboration approaches
  • Experience with at least one Agile collaboration tool
  • 5+ years experience of working with CI/CD
  • Cloud native Database technology.
  • Experience with Monitoring and alerting systems

Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Be a SME for Global Mobility, go-to person for queries on all types of cross border hires, sparring partner to the People function as well as the business and support to ensure cross border hires are set up correctly and compliantly.

In this super interesting role you will provide consultancy/advisory services for all cross border hires including, but not limited to, Global Mobility policies, processes, compliance, cost estimates, through to ensuring cross border hires are set up correctly and compliantly.

You will be a key player in ensuring both the business and the employee needs are met with good experience all round.

At Maersk we value the diversity of our talent and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job – we value diversity in all its forms, including but not limited to: gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability or religious beliefs.

We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high performing teams.

Key Responsibilities:

1. SME and go-to person for all queries on all types of cross border hires: GM principles (e.g. home-base approach, career assignments, IPS), policies (LTA, STA, L+, Commuter, Int’l Remote Work, Tax), high level processes and vendor services

2. Be the sparring partner & advisor for HRBPs and PPs during recruitment of all potential international candidates (new hires and internal) which includes but not limited to:

a)      Propose suitable GM policies for the hire by asking the right questions

b)      Be able to justify recommendation/s, explain decisions, policy elements and pitfalls and provide cost estimates of the various scenarios

c)      Assessment of cross border hires using either a GM Checklist (manual) or a technology tool (TBD)

d)      Help with advice and explanation of resulting recommendations to the business and push back when necessary

e)      Initiate hiring (including assignments), keeping home and host (or new home) HR in the loop until the employee is hired and settled in the new role

 

3. Work with PA Organisations, HRBPs, People Partners & Recruiters to ensure the international hire is set up correctly; from the review of employment contracts (including LOA if applicable) through to advising payrolls (incl shadow if applicable), compliance reporting (impacted countries) and candidate’s tax and SS set up (i.e., home &/or host contributions)

4. Be aware of compliance challenges (immigration, PWD, minimum wage, tax & social security, business travels) and be able to highlight them. Know when to seek further advice from external consultants without incurring unnecessary cost to company (CTC).

5. Understand high level pension and social security implications and be able to explain them

6. Understand the high level principles of tax and social security treaties, need for CoCs/A1s and be able to explain the basic principles

7. Understand and be able to explain principles of payrolls and shadow payrolls for international cross border hires

8. Know when to consult and be able to work with key stakeholders: GM COE, Employee Wage Tax, Corporate Tax, Finance, Payrolls, GMO and/or vendors in the course of assessing, advising and setting up of cross border hires to ensure full compliance

9. Advisor for the Exceptions process throughout the entire life cycle of a cross border hire:

a)      Review exception requests for reasonableness and push back when necessary

b)      Be able to get the real justifications/reasons for each exception request to policies if pursuing

c)      Review the business case and seek approvals

d)      Be able to explain to the HRBP/PP/Recruiter/Candidate when not approved

e)      Document for policies review

 

10. Able to explain GM principles and methodologies such as the Balance Sheet approach, the items contained and the impact of changes (FX, COL-I, family size, etc)

11. Be the eyes & ears of GM on the ground, immediately consult the COE and help with handling initial responses to unforeseen situations, e.g. the COVID pandemic where employees were stranded in all sorts of locations with compliance and health and safety implications

Who we are looking for:

1. Minimum 7 years’ global mobility operational experience

2. Minimum 5 years’ experience in global mobility advisory role

3. Candidates with tax and/or immigration background preferred

4. Excellent problem solving, resilient, collaborative, think big picture yet with an eye for details, analytical

5. Great communication and people skills to all levels of the organisation

6. Global Mobility / International HR
7. Immigration, tax, social security and employment laws knowledge preferred
8. Experience with Assignment Pro and/or Workday preferred

The team interacts primarily with stakeholders in the Product team as well as internal stakeholders in Finance. The Product team is overall responsible for the global Profit and Loss, the Product Strategy and future product development.
As Finance Business Partner (FBP) you will have the opportunity to drive financial analysis, performance management and decision support to the Product leadership team. Your detailed understanding of the financial numbers combined with solid business knowledge will allow you to deliver performance insight, challenge current understandings and contribute to decision making within Warehouse & Distribution.
As part of a dynamic finance community, you will be working closely together with the Regional and Area product teams. Further you will drive alignment with stakeholders in other Finance teams. You will be exposed to senior management and a truly global organisation.
At Maersk we value the diversity of our talent and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job – we value diversity in all its forms, including but not limited to: gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability or religious beliefs.

The FBP is expected to drive key financial processes and operating system in close collaboration with stakeholders in the Product team, Finance and the frontline. You will support their decision-making process and understanding of financials and performance by structuring and presenting key focus areas in management meetings, providing financial management information, deep dive analysis, performance management reporting and business cases.

Through close interaction with your stakeholders, you will understand their information needs and help them design and develop existing and new initiatives, report to stakeholders with clear business and financial insights and perform analyses of performance and trends to identify and suggest appropriate actions.

Specific Key Responsibilities

  • Drive accurate, timely and aligned reporting of financial information of L&S product and segment on management reporting tools and systems.

  • Support the decision-making by providing value-added analysis, financial management information, deep dive analysis, performance management reporting and financial planning.

  • Provide forward looking financial analysis and also perform ad-hoc analysis to provide insights to business and challenge business performance.

  • The financial analysis must be supported by efficient and clear communication to stakeholders and decision makers.

  • Facilitate the Maersk Operating System (MOS) and standard work within the L&S finance organization.

  • Prepare and support product Budgeting, Forecasting and Business Plans.

  • Evaluate and report financial implications of proposed investments and transactions to the leadership.

  • Manage and ensure all necessary processes and controls are in place to ensure compliance.

  • Drive continuous improvements including simplification of reports, analysis tools and automation of reporting

  • Take part in Logistics and Services tasks and projects including input to external reporting

  • Support in smooth and efficient integration of M&A entities in financial reporting and Business case realisation

This role need to work with peers across Global FPNA teams, Product Organisation as well as Senior Management as a sparring partner. Role should support the decision-making process by providing value-added analysis, financial management information, deep dive analysis, performance management reporting and financial planning.

The financial analysis must be supported by efficient and clear communication to stakeholders and decision makers.

The Integrated Order Management IOM initiative fulfils our integrator vision. They will enjoy seamless and unified experience with a single order Id for all available services, eliminating the need to buy and track each transport leg and/or service individually.

  • Apply tools, methodologies and standard methodologies for the improvement of the product development process, and to facilitate simple fast and cloud-based releases

  • Experience with microservices and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes)

  • We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high-performing teams.​

Key Responsibilities

The Finance Business Partner will own all financial data and deliver accurate and timely information for financial and KPI reporting, establishing a strong link between insights from financial performance and recommended operational actions. You will also be expected to drive improvement initiatives which will bring further data transparency and will enable stronger data-driven decision making.

Key tasks:

  • Have a strong presence across both MUM fleet groups as well as the Dry-Docking team, providing financial insights to co-drive performance with operational colleagues.

  • Support business decisions by leaders through data-driven insights into both financial and operational performance, with recommended actions.

  • Be a sparring partner who challenges assumptions, providing forward looking, independently initiated analysis which highlights risks and opportunities.

  • Perform financial analysis for operational scenarios to facilitate decision making.

  • Drive cost saving initiatives through constructive and continuous follow up with relevant stakeholders.

  • Coordinate rolling forecast process, ensuring that both short and long-term strategic priorities are accommodated.

  • Prepare periodic management reporting, including variance analysis, explanations, and related proposed actions.

  • Support month and year-end closing processes, including monthly performance review processes.

  • Drive process efficiencies and finance digital transformation through development of BI tools.

  • Develop and strengthen financial models to provide strong insights and support decision making.

  • Provide visibility to management on progression against strategic initiatives.

  • Take the lead to implement process improvements which you will identify through data analysis and feedback from stakeholders.

  • Deliver insights and recommendations relating to fleet group performance vs. internal benchmarks.

  • Manage and ensure all necessary processes and controls are in place to ensure compliance.

  • Maintain close and strong relationship with all stakeholders.

  • Contribute to identifying and bringing synergies across the fleet groups, including execution of agreed actions.

Who we are looking for:

The ideal candidate will have a relevant degree in Finance or Economics, combined with 5+ years of relevant work experience in finance positions.

You:

  • Are a passionate, self-starting and goal-oriented finance business partner.

  • Communicate clearly and engage confidently with leaders at all levels.

  • Possess excellent analytical & problem-solving skills.

  • Have knowledge in developing and strengthening financial models.

  • Have an eager to challenge the status quo and identify areas for improvement.

  • Are comfortable with driving change through project management skills.

  • Are well organised and able to prioritise effectively.

  • Are strong in the details but comfortable in explaining key messages in simple terms.

  • Have a flair for building relationships and can exert influence without authority.

  • Possess a strong natural drive for results and excellent stakeholder management skills.

  • Are known for your curiosity and level of energy you bring

  • Have expertise in the use of Excel & PowerPoint. Proficiency in the use of Power BI is an advantage.

  • Are fluent in written and spoken English.

If you have a strong background in Network Communication infrastructure, a service mindset, and are passionate about quality, innovation, speed and impact, then read on!

 
We offer: As Lead Platform Architect, you will be actively managing standards and coaching our architects and engineering teams to modernize, deploy, operate, and maintain our edge communications network capabilities. These mission critical capabilities will be deployed globally in our industrial facilities and vessels forming our global supply chain. 
This is a leadership and “hands on” role, you will draw from your deep and broad technical expertise to mentor coach and develop the skills and capabilities of our architects and engineers, completing hands-on technical work and resolving complex issues and challenges. 
You will be working with the largest technology providers globally. Using cutting-edge technologies with significant opportunities to develop, demonstrate and broaden your technology career. 
 
Key Responsibilities: • Responsible for defining, improving and road mapping the architecture and designs for our Standardized Edge Communications Network product offering.

• Responsible for defining architectural descriptions and design artefacts ensuring they are maintained, usable and meet stakeholder concerns.

• Responsible for shaping the product offering in conjunction with the platform stakeholders advising on options and recommending solutions.

• Responsible for providing architectural leadership to the team to ensure compliance and adherence of products and services is to the defined architecture specifications, requirements, and industry best practices in a timely manner.

• Responsible for guidance and resolution of technical issues and challenges faced by engineering teams in the implementation of standardized architectures. 

• Work with technology partners, senior engineering managers, product owners, scrum masters and scrum teams to do release and sprint planning.

• Work closely with global, regional, and local stakeholders on regular basis to bridge the gap between technology and business.

• Actively drive the career growth of engineers and team members by defining technical skills and technical training within the area of your architectural scope.

• Actively Attract world class talent and provide technical guidance, career development, and mentoring to team members.

• Represent Maersk on key industry standards forums and work with the team to publish research and represent Maersk at industry and technology standards bodies and forums. 
We are looking for: • A total of 10+ years of industry experience with 5+ years of experience in architecting and/or developing and delivering end to end products/solutions. Minimum of 3+ years of experience in managing teams.

• Significant Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for fixed local area network infrastructure using the Cisco 3 Layer model and connected factory models (Preferentially in industrial environments.)

• Significant Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for wireless network infrastructure (Preferentially in industrial environments or other applications with mission critical performance levels.).

• Significant Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for 4G and 5G cellular infrastructure (Preferentially in industrial environments, automated guided vehicle applications or other applications with mission critical performance levels.).

• Significant Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for wide area networking including software design networks (Preferentially in hybrid cloud environments with mission critical performance levels.).

• Significant Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for cloud native IaaS and infrastructure as a code in Hybrid cloud setups.

• Experience in architecting and defining standards and specifications for integrated networking.

• Experience in model driven architecture developing physical and logical architectures for infrastructure with an industrial focus.

• Experience in technical coaching and mentoring architects’ and engineering teams in an Agile Environment

• Experience in the application of Architecture Management Frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman, SABSA etc) 

• Experience in the application Cyber Security Controls and Mitigations in architectural designs and Application of security frameworks such as ISO 27001, SABSA, COBIT, ISA-99/ISO 62443 and or NIST.

• Is familiar with the planning, estimating and execution of programmes of development work to time, budget and quality targets. The identification of the resources needed for development and how this will be met with an effective supply capacity. The alignment of development activity and deliverables with agreed architectures and standards. 

• Is familiar with agile principles and values, e.g., the Agile Manifesto. Has practical experience in software development with agile methods, e.g., Scrum or Kanban with an infrastructure as code bias.

• Is familiar with identifying new and emerging technologies, products, services, methods, and techniques. Can assess their relevance and the potential impacts (both threats and opportunities) upon business enablers, cost, performance, or sustainability. Can communicate emerging technologies and their impact.

The Business Platforms organization in Maersk is at the forefront of developing cutting edge technologies to improve the customer’s experience with personalized and automated end-to-end digital journeys, that enable Maersk customers to access standardized products and services seamlessly. The Platforms help enable Maersk’s vision to be the Global Integrator of container logistics, connecting and simplifying customers’ supply chains.

The CRM Platform Team defines best-in-class digital tools for Marketing, Sales and Customer Service colleagues that enables them to create delightful and integrated experiences for our Customers, while making them the most effective and productive. In a diverse, ambitious, and curious team, we solve challenging and impactful problems for our customers and customer facing business teams.

Opportunity

Maersk is looking for Platform Product Owner who will be responsible for defining best-in-class digital tools for our Marketing colleagues that enables them to effectively identify Prospects and Customers, interact through multi-channel digital touchpoints, build awareness and nurture them through a highly engaging buying journey.

 

A successful candidate will be business outcome focused, data driven, highly emphatic, quickly grasp complex problems, build trusted relationships and seamlessly collaborate with cross functional platform teams, Business Leaders, Engineering, CX and Data teams to come up with scalable solutions that enables Maersk to improve life for all by integrating the world.

 

We Offer

Maersk, the world's largest shipping company, is transforming into an industrial digital giant that enables global trade with its land, sea and port assets. Through Digital Transformation we identify, define and implement the mix of process, technology and culture that brings business, development and operation teams closer, allowing Maersk to deliver products faster, improve responsiveness and enhance quality for our consumers.

 

What do we bring to the table?

A role in leading the digital transformation in worldwide logistics and impacting global trade via the largest container shipping company in the world!

• The ability to influence the digitization on an industry and use digital advancements as the center-point of the transformation

• We are passionate about using technology to solve our customers supply chain challenges all over the globe

• We value opinions and experiences across our diverse teams with colleagues from different backgrounds and cultures

• We offer the freedom and responsibility, to shape the setup and processes we use in our community

• A focused but balanced working environment, where we are passionate about continuous learning and self growth, including through our active community of practices, conferences, workshops and meetups

 

At Maersk, we focus on the individual’s development and the right candidate will have broad possibilities to further develop competencies in an environment characterized by change and continuous progress.

We value the diversity of our talent and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job – we value diversity in all its forms, including but not limited to: gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability or religious beliefs.

 

Key responsibilities

This is a great position for someone who can deliver customer-centric solutions with leadership and influence on technology, product and business teams. You will be expected to make appropriate trade-offs to optimize time-to-market, clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote teams.

In this highly visible role, with ownership, accountability, great communication and relationship skills, being a team player, an innovator, and always being data-driven, you will help shape the strategy that will positively impact millions of containers and shipments around the world.

 

On any given day, the Platform Product Owner will

• Define and own the product roadmap that is aligned with business objectives, and translate it into goals for the individual teams

• Own Communications with the wider team around milestone and release plans along with owning the product backlog

• Research and specify new features and enhancements to existing features. Document the requirements via well defined specifications and review with the team and stakeholders

• Bring together engineers, UX designers, and Business from around the company to build and release product features & capabilities as per plan

• You will orchestrate and be ultimately responsible for products within your own track, and be able to define and track core KPI(s)

• Champion customer and stakeholder needs throughout roadmap execution, ensuring that what is delivered meets the original goals and objectives

• Act quickly on trends and opportunities by staying up to date on an extremely dynamic and competitive industry

• Create, monitor, and evaluate the impact of experiments using a combination of analytical tools & research methods

• And when a product ships, popping the cork from the champagne bottle to celebrate!

 

Who we are looking for

These requirements would make you a great fit for the role

• Strong product management experience in understanding business problems, identifying solutions, defining capabilities and features, prioritizing and managing trade-offs, writing user stories and driving roadmaps and timelines

• Adept in aligning Senior Business Leaders (VP+), Engineering Leads, Data and CX teams towards roadmap strategy

• Proven track record of customer obsession

• Demonstrated ability to think both strategically and tactically

• Proficiency in formulating data-driven decisions that lead to results and measuring results Vs. intended KPIs

• Experience in Agile/SCRUM enterprise-scale software development

• Experience in building B2B Digital Marketing and Content Management capabilities encompassing Digital Asset Taxonomy, Search Engine Optimization, Account Based Marketing, Personalization, Nurture Flows, Contact Management, Segmentation, Targeting, Campaign and Lead Management

• Knowledge of Marketo, Salesforce.com Marketing Cloud, Sitecore, Adobe Experience Manager or any other Marketing automation and Content Management tools is an added advantage

 

We would be thrilled if you had these additional qualifications

MBA/Software Engineering Educational Qualification

Location: UK, Denmark, India (BLR/Mum/Pune)

Digitisation and IT are taking centre stage in enabling this engagement. Join us in Transport and Logistics IT as we re-think what technology can do to drive growth.

This is a hybrid role where you will be part of the Cyber Security Architect team which oversees the definition and choices of strategic security capabilities and their solutions for the whole of the Cyber Platform. The team ensures that chosen capabilities meet the needs of Business Platforms, achieve the necessary organizational cyber security posture, align with Enterprise Architectural principles, and are optimized for value and efficiency.

The role

This is a global position which can be based in either UK/ Europe OR India (Bangalore/ Pune). Applications will be considered under the country of origin from where you have applied from.

This is a key role in support of Maersk Technology's movement to platform-based development and increased usage of microservices, including (but not limited to) disconnected cloud platform (Azure). Joining Maersk Technology as a Cyber Security Technical Leader will enable you to gain broad business knowledge of the company’s activities globally, in addition to understanding how the complexity of technology supports the digitized transport and logistics business. The role operates using agile methodology delivering timely and effective cyber security of general and bespoke solutions.

As an Architect within the Cyber Security Architecture team, you will be responsible for driving technical security improvement from design through delivery and into operations through good practices and representing the importance and business benefit of Cyber Security –  across the 7 Cyber Change Delivery products/Security uplifts.

Other responsibilities include:

  • Maintain awareness of the security challenges faced across the numerous platforms, via the Portfolio Security Engineers
  • Support definition of security requirements for systems and components and interpreting security standards and principles for delivery teams
  • Embedding Secure-by-Design and Secure Development Life Cycle principles with delivery teams
  • Review early stage and late stage designs, identifying potential security issues
  • Understand and clearly identify Cyber Security risk within an agile development environment, highlighting risks to Cyber Security for inclusion in the Risk Register (Archer) and to inform prioritization of Cyber Security Backlog items.
  • Articulate identified risk during development, to development teams and help mitigate – advising on suitable, cost-effective security measures throughout development phases (Agile/DevOps)
  • Support Platform Tech leads on their (emerging) Cyber Risk posture as part of Monthly Platform Reviews
  • Guiding development initiatives on specific security questions by taking the lead on finding technical Cyber Security solutions
  • Support arranging appropriate security assurance activities as required
  • Support integration and Cyber Security alignment to other areas as required

What will you bring?

You will be a communicator and a collaborator. With excellent written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills, you will be able to work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to explain complex ideas in a concise manner. This role, does not require you to have direct reports, but you will be able to demonstrate strong Leadership Experience, and have a proven delivery track record.

You will have solid technical experience across Cyber Security generally and excellent knowledge of Security Architecture principles, Frameworks and Standards and experience in one or more of the following:

  • Experience with application of Cyber Security within DevSecOps, with a good understanding of customer centric design principles and software development.
  • Excellent knowledge and understanding of securing Cloud Technologies (Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP)
  • Excellent understanding of IAM, PKI and App Containerization
  • Good understanding of SAST/DAST

As a performance-oriented company, we strive to always recruit the best person for the job – regardless of gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation or religious beliefs. We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high-performing teams.

Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. Are you ready to impact an industry? Are you passionate about unlocking business value with data and advanced analytics? Join our exceptional team of experienced business and technology leaders and highly talented data engineers and data scientists!

Data is key to integrating supply chains and to give people across the world an excellent experience when involved in global trade. Unlocking the value of data in an industry that has just begun its technological transformation is an exciting challenge and an immense opportunity! Maersk has embarked on an ambitious journey to disrupt itself and to tackle just that. Our Global Data & Analytics teams are at the heart of making this real. Are you ready to join us and rethink the way we serve our customers, provide new products and offer outstanding experiences?

Data Product Delivery Lead - Fleet & Emissions Platform - Copenhagen - Denmark, Bangalore, India or Maidenhead, UK

Maersk is leveraging data to revolutionise the shipping industry. Help us optimize our vessel utilization, reduce our carbon footprint and be part of the team in building the Global Data & Analytics (GDA) strategy for Fleet Management and our Decarbonisation initiative. Maersk’s strategy is powered by data as the key enabler and our unique competitive advantage, your passion, and leadership are critical for success in a role that has a direct influence on our company’s transformation.

As Data Product Delivery Lead for Fleet & Emissions, you will be a change leader and champion for insights and data product developments that will form the foundation of the division’s digital evolution. You will play a key role in evaluating and designing cross-functional enterprise business processes and products, and partner with leaders across the teams to execute new workflows. You will use your engineering expertise, innovative mindset, and thought leadership to identify, design, and deliver superior data products in close collaboration with your stakeholders. Finally, you will push for the use of AI/ML to improve processes in Maersk and services to our Customers.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

The role of the Data Product Delivery Lead will define and drive the data strategy across the 700+ vessels and the enterprise-wide decarbonisation by working closely with cross-functional team across business, platform portfolios and technology stakeholders across the company. Lead the effort in defining and executing data & analytics strategy, building a data-driven organization, and envisioning innovative and focused approaches to standardize and rollout data products across Maersk.

  • Lead a team for 3 to 4 squads comprising of scrum masters, analysts, engineers (data, ML) including design and technical mentorship

  • Partner with business leaders and platform product owners to create product roadmaps and develop data products solving problems including decarbonization, predictive maintenance of assets and vessels, charter market forecasting and availability and controls for risk and audit

  • Transition and work in a target-state embedded operating model with platform portfolio owners and participate in the agile ceremony cadence in delivering high velocity and success

  • Where needed work directly with the business product owners and deliver on-time solutions to meet the functional growth demands

  • Collaborate with principal architects and software delivery teams to prevent overlapping work and coordinate on interoperability requirements

  • An entrepreneurial mindset with a passion to push the boundaries of innovation

  • Meet financial objectives by forecasting requirements; preparing an annual budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions

  • Manage technical debt and technology trade-offs, communicating those to the product and platform product owners

  • Accelerate a thriving data-driven culture using quantitative and qualitative measures that tie to business objectives, with continuous improvements

  • Identify opportunities and develop roadmap to improve adoption of AI/ML techniques providing increased value and growth

  • Hire and develop high quality engineers while strengthening morale and cohesion across the teams

  • Collaborate with multi-functional teams to develop a comprehensive understanding of the key drivers and opportunities within the business

  • Handle priorities and clearly communicate expectations to department heads and the executive team

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Are you a natural bar-raiser: curious and passionate, with a desire to continuously learn more, which you use to understand basic business operations and the organizational levers that drive profitable growth. Communication, collaboration and visionary to transform from basic BI to insights and AI/ML driven organization.

  • Experience in leading high-performance, global teams with demonstrated and measurable results, and in planning and prioritizing product platform roadmaps to launch successful data products and services.

  • Capability to deliver data products using a variety of techniques (from configuration to customization or even crafting of models) across descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive– with knowledge of when to use which technique

  • Experience driving complex tasks and projects to mitigate risk. You carefully evaluate and anticipate risks with mitigations before taking action, clearly articulate options and their impacts/consequences. You course correct when needed, expecting to fail fast and respond efficiently.

  • Ability to facilitate ongoing prioritization discussions, obtain consensus among stakeholders and carry those decisions through to communication materials, with refresh as needed

  • Ability to fully understand business goals and metrics, turn data into insights, and translate requirements into actionable analysis

  • Excellent interpersonal skills including teamwork, issue resolution, negotiation, and relationship management

  • Ability to present complicated technology concepts in a simple manner, and present key technology challenges or overviews relevant to senior technology leadership

  • Good knowledge of multi-cloud data ecosystem and build scalable solutions on the cloud (Azure, GCP and AWS)

  • Good knowledge of Big Data Ecosystem (data lake, lake house, data mesh), Spark, Python, Kafka, Hadoop, Databricks, and common third-party integration and orchestration tools.

  • A strong passion for adopting and introducing standard, automated, and repeatable processes and led teams through fast-paced development cycles; committed to automation, agile, lean-startup, continuous delivery approach and reducing total cost of ownership

  • Strong communication skills (written, and oral) and ability to coordinate across a diverse group of technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Able to work across organizational boundaries and matrixed reporting structures

  • Lead mostly with questions rather than opinions, thriving on the opportunity to own, innovate, create, and constantly re-evaluate

  • Passionate about engaging and developing talent; attract, develop, engage, and retain talented individuals with a compelling, unifying vision that steers and motivates

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (Desirable)

  • Knowledge of the shipping and/or logistics industry

  • Worked in a distributed work environment

  • Hands on architecture and design in building data products especially with IOT data

About Maersk

Maersk is committed to an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize global trade. This will require a team that both understands and can lead the way in world class service and operations.  Do you see yourself enjoying lots of opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the globe, expanding your skills in an atmosphere that prioritizes employee growth and being a part of an inspiring work environment?  Then join us as we reinvent the future of integrated logistics.  

What gets you out of bed each morning: 

The Purpose that drives us: To improve life for all by integrating the world. “Our purpose is the reason why we get out of bed each morning – looking forward to a new and exciting day. It’s not about making money, but what we contribute to the world we all share. That means satisfying our customers, attracting and retaining great talent, and conducting ourselves as a responsible and valued member of our communities,” says CEO Soren Skou.  

The purpose guides us in being at our best – and that, we imagine, you share with us.  

Working at Maersk 

At Maersk, we're building a culture where everyone can feel at home. We don't just work across continents, we work across different genders, generations, cultures, sexual orientations, religions, disabilities and perspectives. Together, we succeed as one global team. We want to encourage innovation and empower our teams to share new ways of thinking, making the most of our diverse talents. But it’s also about feeling involved and encouraged to be yourself.
We’re excited for you to become part of our team and fully join in the adventure ahead.

Building a Centre of Excellence for managing Fraud risks

A.P. Moller - Maersk A/S is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify customers’ supply chains. As a global leader in container logistics services, the company employs approximately 95.000 people and operates in 130 countries. A With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.

This complex scope of businesses brings with it various risks, key among them being the risk of Fraud. Towards this, Maersk has recently set up a Fraud Risk Management division focused on advising and assisting the various business units in its Group to minimise and manage the risk of Fraud.   

As part of the Fraud Risk Management team, every day is an exciting new day with new challenges coming your way. Maersk gives you a real life opportunity to see what it means when it comes to handling the various facets of fraud risk management viz. Prevention, Detection and Investigation of frauds.

Prevention: as part of the prevention work stream, you will get an opportunity to help and advise the business in preventing frauds from occurring, some of them are extremely innovative given the complex business environment we operate in.

Detection: as part of the detection work stream, you will be responsible for setting up world class leading fraud detection techniques including large scale data driven analytical dashboards to detect potential frauds as well as proactive fraud identification.

Investigation: as part of the Investigation work stream, you will get to investigate some of the cutting edge frauds that are happening across the globe in the logistics and shipping industry.

The current requirement is a part of the Detection work stream where among others, we intend to use the billions of data points Maersk generates every day to be able to not just detect frauds but eventually be able to predict frauds as well. As a Data Scientist, you will use your analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect large data sets to develop data-driven solutions explicitly tailored toward the needs of the organization. You will get an opportunity to test your data analytical skills, logical thinking, and also technical skills for creating proof of concepts by using Python, SQL, Power BI and other tools as may be necessary to achieve the end objectives.

If the above excites you and you want to apply for this role, keep in mind the below requirements:

  • 4-8 years of relevant working experience
  • University or higher degree in Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, is desirable.
  • Hands on experience in using Python and SQL to build and apply data science models
  • Experience in Power BI, or similar is a plus.
  • Experience in business intelligence, machine learning and data science
  • Certifications in Data analytics would be good to have
  • Experience in identifying and implementing analytics best practices.
  • Experience in accounting will be an added advantage
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, communications, and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with business at all levels
  • Handles most situations independently with minimal guidance but will seek advice and guidance on more complex issues.
  • Understands the overall nature of the business and the interdependencies between own and other functions.

  • Ability to coordinate and work with upstream and downstream teams to achieve excellent results within deadlines
  • Is a self-starter with a strong driving force, striving for continuous improvement, be able to see opportunities and wanting to solve problems

We are currently looking for a Senior Scrum Master to join our APM Terminals Terminal Integration Platform team based in Bengaluru.

We offer

We are building cross-functional feature teams, each tackling a different problem within our business domain. Scrum is our methodology of choice, and we seek to continuously refine our process to suit our needs.

We strive to empower each team with as much autonomy as possible, but don’t shy away from cross team alignment when it adds value.

Our work culture is collaborative, and we believe that giving everyone a chance to be heard produces the best results. We believe in an environment where each of us takes ownership and responsibility for developing and implementing new ways of working.

Our software solutions are built on open source technologies like Kakfa, Debezium. Our architecture is microservice based and we always aim to use the technologies and cloud services that best suit our needs.

Key responsibilities

As a Scrum Master for one or more teams, you will work in a servant leader capacity. You will be responsible for making sure the team lives by agile values. You will be the guardian of the scrum team. You will facilitate the scrum ceremonies and work to resolve impediments.

You will monitor the scrum process and work to ensure efficiency across the team, pushing for changes that will ensure quality and value for the business outcomes. You will keep the team motivated, coach them, and ensures observance of the definition of done. You ensure the scrum team executes the backlog according to the priorities defined by the Product Owner, deliver on time, and with production-ready quality.

  • Build high-performing and self-organizing teams that deliver business values though agile way of working.
  • Run sprint ceremonies with teams working in different locations across the globe.

We will be diving deep into skills ontologies and talent market-place technologies, designing to create an integrated experience for our people across the diverse Maersk organization.

The HR Technology Software Engineer will provide thought leadership, solution design and technical expertise to our Technology organization and People organization.  

We use Workday as our core platform and will build from that.  

We are looking for a driven and structured technology specialist.  You have worked with cloud solutions in the HR Technology space before.  We are particularly interested in people with previous exposure of talent marketplace, visible career pathing, skills driven development and creating holistic cohesive technology experiences across several platforms.

You should enjoy working in a dynamic, diverse and open organization, and feel motivation from high pace, changing environments and being able to work together with your colleagues to create an great experience for our people.

You will be a key contributor in your domain and be part of one of our agile teams, thus expected to actively help manage our backlog

You will work closely with our business in a collaborative mindset, with co-creation and co-decisions as our common framework.

Travel might be needed depending on project and activity.

Here are some of the activities you will experience on your new job:

  • Contribute to the development, maintenance, and implementation of roadmaps within HR Technology, anchored with business needs.
  • Participate or lead the design to secure holistic solutions across the talent and learning technology domain.
  • Collaborate with colleagues in solutioning, using global design principles.
  • Act as expert support on HR tech related incidents and requests.  Support stakeholders and initiatives with solution and technical expertise.
  • Gain practical understanding of our implementation methodology and lifecycle of our projects
  • Gather and translate business requirements, demonstrating capabilities in selected technologies, collaborating with vendors and implementation partners as needed
  • Design and configure sustainable solutions that enable the people experience and business requirements as decided by the process owners and business owners.
  • Lead, support and execute tests to secure and validate the processes and design together with the business.
  • Collaborate and work in an agile way within our agile teams, with opportunities to learn and grow also in adjacent areas within HR Technology.

We are looking for someone with experience in:

  • HR Learning Technology – Workday and different talent and learning technologies for talent marketplace, skills ontologies, LXP etc.
  • Ability to process large, critical data sets with high accuracy
  • Project management capability and personal organizational skills
  • Great communicator both written and verbal
  • Ability to translate technical information to a language that can influence stakeholders at all levels
  • Continuously drive improvements, and ability to identify these, proactively seeking insight and answers
  • Critical thinking and experience with design thinking
  • A continuous learner and curiosity in new HR technology

And who is characterized by:

  • A robust approach to changes and ability to operate in a dynamic environment 
  • Great stakeholder management skills and ability to operate in a complex ecosystem including navigating the internal IT landscape and partnering with the right teams and vendors to deliver on business outcomes
  • Being a team-player who always strives to do what is best and right in the greater picture

  • Perform 3way match once Workflow is created in SAP including Urgent request

  • Check the correctness of material, cost, bank details between cost created and invoice received

  • Ensure Withholding Tax is calculated correctly and accounted while posting the invoice

  • Engaging with vendors for payment related matters, Payment block removal

  • Coordinate with internal as well as external stakeholders to ensure local, global and legal requirements are met

  • Coordinate with FINOPS / CSO and flag dispute in Workflow basis their input

  • AP related India GST Analysis & Reconciliation between Vendor Register (GSTR 2A) Vs Purchase Register (Sub Ledger).
