High-Level Position Purpose: The Supply Chain Development Sr Analyst is part of Maersk’s Global Supply Chain Development function within Maersk Sales. The role reports into the leader of the Mumbai office for Supply Chain Development within the Global Service Centre of Maersk. The role contributes to logistics solution sales for Maersk customers, based on identifying and quantifying opportunities and tailoring value propositions for Maersk’s priority customers.
The role will provide a fantastic opportunity to work on cutting edge areas of logistics and supply chain management services across multiple industries. The role is a stepping stone to build a long and successful career in logistics, especially within the global organization of Maersk. In addition to growth opportunities within the team, the mentorship, trainings and on-the-ground learnings will motivate and inspire candidates towards becoming an expert on supply chains. 
The role will involve working closely with regional teams of Supply Chain Development (SCD) to identify and sell Maersk value propositions to customers. The regional SCD team members (across different regions of the world) will be directly working on specific customer opportunities with account managers for the respective customers to identify, qualify and pitch compelling value propositions to new and existing logistics customers. The SCD Sr Analyst will also be working with the lead of the Regional Manager on opportunities to drive high impact customer engagement, thought leadership and in depth understanding of logistics industry and Maersk services. The supply chain development managers will be involved in creating customized and innovative supply chain solutions for Maersk’s customers. While the SCD manager role will likely remotely engaged with the customer and internal stakeholders, there will be customer facing opportunities for the Sr Analyst role for IBS based clients. The role will also contribute to the continued improvement and innovation in the Supply Chain Development team and the larger commercial organization and thereby be recognized globally for in depth knowledge and problem solving on supply chain topics, including proficient execution of analysis and modelling task.


Key Responsibilities
 
▪Support Regional Managers of Supply Chain Development team on identifying opportunities with customers and selling compelling Maersk logistics solutions – the SCD analyst will be assigned to specific opportunities where she/he will work under the leadership of the SCD Regional manager with a Maersk multi-functional sales pursuit team
▪ Execute analyses and modelling tasks as needed to aid the sales opportunity 
▪ Focus on quantifiable value and other implications for customer and Maersk wherever possible
▪ Prepare reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and translating complex findings into written text with critical thinking skills 
▪ Manage own tasks in the pursuit team to the highest quality within the assigned deadline
▪Strong communication and presentation skills to elicit the implications of the assigned tasks for the customer and Maersk
▪Display ownership of the pursuit, with ability to manage and communicate to stakeholders towards the success of the sales pursuit
▪Possess and continue learning of supply chain industry and Maersk’s offerings
▪Drive and contribute to innovation, standardization and capability-building areas in the SCD team
▪Display role model behaviour on ownership, motivation and teamwork

By providing the expertise and port infrastructure essential to world trade, we actively support the advancement of the societies around us, enabling local economies to unlock their potential and build an even stronger global community. Working with a team of talented professionals you will get a chance to experience different cultures and make friends all over the world.   You’ll find a culturally diverse, stimulating environment at any of our offices, terminals or depots. When you join APM Terminals, the world is your workplace. APM Terminals is an independent business unit within the Danish Maersk Group – a Global Fortune 500 company with about 89,000 employees and offices in 130 countries with global growth opportunities in a range of fields from shipping and energy to our offshore and manufacturing industries - Join us to achieve even your most ambitious career goals!
Jobs.JobDescription:
At Maersk, we are transforming to become the global integrator of container logistics- connecting and simplifying our customers’ supply chains. The Technology Group is critical to realising the company strategy. We plan on significantly enhancing our Technology capabilities and are implementing a new technology architecture led through Platform Operating Model. The Cloud Engineering Unit within the Technology Group is accountable for end to end delivery of Service Reliability, Availability, Performance, Cost and Fit for Purpose solutions there by enabling the Platform Operating Model.

Introduction to the Role

The Cloud Engineering unit is looking for Software Engineers in SRE team to apply software development principles and practices to effectively run our Infrastructure and efficiently solve difficult operations problems, and in doing so continuously meet and/or improve our Customer Experience. As an SRE, you will be evangelizing, building tools and implementing the priorities around reliability that includes infrastructure, product, data and devops. The team will play a significant role in building capabilities through productising observability, automation, integrations, performance, devops and lot more related to high availability and reliability of services, and in doing so partnering with the multiple teams to help establish and drive reliability engineering culture. You will be applying SRE principles to maintain and improve the performance of our services both in on-premise and cloud environments, there by balancing the priorities between Perform (Production on-premise) and Transform (towards Cloud).

The SRE Engineer, will be

Playing a pivotal role in connecting Technology, Products, Process and End Users, your Key Responsibilities will include –

  • Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services from inception and design, deployment, operation, and refinement
  • Develop and implement capabilities around observability, Status Pages, chaos engineering, toil reduction, deployment methods and lot more from ground up
  • Evangelize, prioritize and implement Operational requirements of high availability, fault tolerant and other resiliency patterns required for delightful customer experience through use of SRE principles
  • Manage and optimize infrastructure and monitoring ecosystem, this includes leveraging various technologies as defined by Enterprise Architecture and bringing your development skills to deliver performance of the operating environments
  • Lead triaging of complex issues at enterprise level and manage stakeholders’ expectations during incidents and/or escalations, while troubleshooting and proactively driving problem management through blames postmortems, eventually owning some of the RCA actions. Participate in on-call rotations as needed
  • Own and support both production run and transformation initiatives to push services towards best-in-class deployment and delivery methodologies, leveraging technologies across on-premise and cloud
  • Collaborate with technology and other stakeholders to set SLO and maintain Service level Indicators (SLI’s) that are representative of our customer experience and/or committed SLA
  • Exploit data, innovate through data engineering and derive insights to improve operations, engineering enhancements, feature development

We are looking out for People, who

Is a passionate Engineer bringing in strong experience from Enterprise grade environment, someone who exemplifies a self-starter, thinking from first principles, continuous learner and could analytically make independent decisions to navigate ambiguities. Exemplifies ‘Has been there and done that’ there by leading by example. An ideal candidate will bring in –

  • 4-6 years in SRE role, with overall 10+ years of experience in heterogeneous environments (DC and Cloud, preferably Azure)
  • Deep expertise in one or more areas of the full stack development and run, evangelized open-source technologies, applied design of experiments or proof of concepts
  • Experienced working in various software development and production run architectures in Monolithic, SOA, Microservices, Distributed systems. Great to have experience in transformation journeys
  • Hands on experience in developing, implementing, integrating various alerting and monitoring tools to create enterprise observability
  • Hands on experience writing high quality code in one or two of the software languages in modern day software engineering environments
  • Good breadth of operational experience, with an eye for software design, performance, scalability and automation. Involved in debugging major problems across production stack
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences

With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Maersk is the largest shipping and container logistics company in the world, we are a $40bn organisation with over 85,000 people. Roughly 20% of the world’s long distance goods is shipped in our containers. We’re bringing our organisation together to become an integrated container shipping and logistics company, fundamentally re-thinking how we do business. Improving our customer experience is a core priority.

We are developing product’s that our customers can use to manage/book engagement with Maersk.

We are currently on the search for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer who will become the second QA in the team and work alongside 14 developers working in our Mobile Apps team where you will be an integral part of ensuring that our customers have the best possible experience using the Maersk app. You will be around highly skilled peers that you will learn and get inspiration from.

The team is actively developing the Maersk mobile app used by our customers throughout the world. While Maersk moves goods around the world, technology is what moves Maersk. The mobile app team is at the forefront of this innovative movement, building the next generation intuitive application, providing customers with a simple to use, end-to-end offering of products and services.

This role involves working in our offices in Copenhagen but we allow a great deal of flexibility.

Key responsibilities

  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases for mobile apps
  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
  • Create automated test suites
  • Performing manual testing (System, Exploratory Testing)
  • Participate in sprints and drive the QA process for mobile app releases.
  • Breaking the system while performing evil laughs

What we are looking for

  • Experience in Android, iOS Mobile Application testing
  • Should have hands-on experience in automated testing of Mobile apps (Android & iOS) using Appium
  • Must have fluency in java or python or any other object oriented language
  • Should have working experience with Maven & TestNG
  • Essential - Good experience of the management of all or part of the test execution phase in projects.
  • Responsible for full life-cycle testing activities (manual) of applications based on defined Requirements.
  • Strong experience in API's and back end testing (REST API , Postman, Rest Assured)
  • Expertise in Identifying memory leakage, connection issues & Bottleneck problem in the application
  • Proactive individual who takes ownership of issues
  • High quality oral and written English communication skills
  • Ability to break the system
  • Well versed with app distraction testing.
  • Understanding of different databases and can be able to write basic SQL queries.
  • Should have working experience in Agile Methodology and should have understanding of sprint iteration.

It would be nice if you have:

  • Understanding of non-functional testing (preferable k6, jmeter, loadrunner)
  • Working experience on Flutter apps or know about Appium-flutter-driver

As a performance-oriented company, we strive to always recruit the best person for the job – regardless of gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation or religious beliefs. We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high-performing teams.

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, apply now.

Quality Engineer

Jobs.JobDescription:
If you want to join a company who is the leader within shipping and supply chain logistics and amongst many things driving the global agenda on decarbonisation, digitalisation, and green fuel, we have an open position in our global Contract Management Team (“CMT”). The team is undergoing a significant transformation which will entail changing from a back-office function to a team of highly skilled professionals who will not only provide contract management services but will act as a professional business partner to our various businesses across the Maersk Group. At Maersk we take a 360-degree view on contract management which means taking a holistic approach to contract management and negotiation. You will work closely with our commercial account owners, product owners and other important stakeholder functions to achieve a win-win result for our customers and Maersk.

The successful candidate will be joining a large team of in-house lawyers, claims specialists, compliance officers and other experts focused on meeting customer needs whilst mitigating risk across the business. The team operates in a matrix organisation, interacting with senior stakeholders from Copenhagen, The Hague and around the world whilst providing important advice and guidance to the business.

Maersk Legal Shared Services provides legal, claims and compliance services to a diverse range of functions across the Maersk Group. The successful candidate will be joining a large team of in-house lawyers, claims specialists, compliance officers and other experts focused on meeting customer needs whilst mitigating risk across the business.

We offer

When you join Maersk, you’ll find that the world is your workplace. You’ll work in a culturally diverse, stimulating environment, surrounded by new ideas and different ways of doing things. We believe in individual performance within highly professional teams supported by our distinctive values. To us teamwork means acceptance, respect, dedication, and the idea that we can achieve more collectively than individually.

Living our values means competing in the marketplace in an ethical way. Our word is our bond, and we conduct ourselves in a way which is synonymous with being a credible and valuable business partner. Through Constant Care and Humbleness, we strive to prepare for the future, while never forgetting that our customers and competitors are key to our ability to improve. In our daily work Uprightness mean that transparency and accountability in everything we do go hand in hand with being an inspiring, challenging place to work. At Maersk, we take pride in hiring the best person for the job – irrespective of gender, age, nationality, or religious belief.

Key responsibilities

  • Reviewing contracts 
  • Liaising closely with business owners and other legal departments in the Group
  • Advising stakeholders on the risks and exposures in contracts by applying a holistic 360-degree review
  • Negotiations with customers and/or suppliers
  • Creating risk management and legal awareness
  • Supporting the HQ and regional legal team and leadership in contract management/governance.

  • Develop ‘eye to eye’ relationship and engagement with internal stakeholders and implement process capability.
  • Provide consistent and predictable high-quality service to business partners and end customers
  • Ensuring a well-governed and diligent contracting process from start to finish

We are looking for

  • The candidate holds a Bachelor of Law or Master of Law and has extensive contract review experience. Candidates with a proven track record within the maritime, supply chain, logistics or similar industry are welcomed to apply. Knowledge of another language besides your native language and English is a plus.
  • The candidate has 5+ years of experience from an internationally oriented law firm or international corporation with an experience in drafting, reviewing, and finalizing maritime, logistics and commercial agreements. 
  • Understanding of international maritime and shipping law is preferred.
  • Given high stakeholder interaction excellent English skills both oral as well as written are required and proven capability in MS Office is required.

Key Measures

  • Ensure high quality delivery review of documents
  • A natural ability to handle a lot on the plate is required with an eye for details.
  • Ability to build and create credibility and perseverance in negotiations.
  • Ability to understand the customer’s pain points and work on a solution to the benefit of both parties. Applying a commercial mindset while ensuring appropriate risk mitigation.

Jobs.JobDescription:
Senior Quality Engineer – Cloud Integration

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive. With a dedicated team of over 80,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, A.P. Moller - Maersk is developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other.

The Maersk group operates one of the most comprehensive marine container terminals networks in the world, under the brand of APM Terminals, with over 20,000 employees operating 76 terminals in 36 countries and growing.

APM Terminals (APMT) plays a critical role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transhipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals, into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator.

We are currently looking for a Senior Quality Engineer to join our APM Terminals Terminal Integration Platform team based in Bengaluru.

We offer

As a Software Developer in Test engineer, you will be working in a product team that is responsible for designing, implementing and supporting cloud-native technologies, as well as mentoring and developing other QA engineers within the APMT Hybrid Cloud team (part of APMT Terminal Integration Platform).  You will be a key member of the product team and work closely with the team to deliver innovative solutions that support our business deliverables within a context of cloud-native, open-source technologies, aligned to our modernisation strategy, with a focus on ensuring high quality deliverables.
 

Key Responsibilities

  • Works day to day as part of the product team, implementing solutions, estimating and sizing activities.
  • Supports their solutions in production as part of a DevSecOps methodology. Staying Secure, always available with high quality.
  • Mentors colleagues and other engineers, providing advice and guidance
  • A secure by design attitude – from TLS certificates, OAuth to industry CIS standards – you know how test security from the start, and then stay secure
  • Follows industry trends and the latest technologies both in the wider technology world, as well as our internal communities of practice, bringing experience from other parts of the organization into the team and contributing back.

We are looking for

For us, it is all about you, and how we can build the best career with you in mind. Of course, we have an expectation around what you can bring to the role - but don't expect that you bring all of the things mentioned below. In short, we use a more holistic approach to the evaluation of our potential employees- so get in touch to see how you can be part of this journey!
Of course, you have a successful QA engineering background, and we would love to hear from you if you can demonstrate expertise and technical skills in a cloud native, secure, open-source, containerised environment across most of the following areas;

  • Must have worked in BDD Test Automation Frameworks like Cucumber-JVM, Cucumber, JBhehave, RSpec, etc.
  • Container Orchestration with Kubernetes. Do you know your Deployments from your StatefulSets?
  • GitOps Desired State Methodologies. You are happy working with yaml files and GitOps tooling
  • Good understanding of API technologies like RESTful, SOAPUI, Kafka, etc.
  • Experienced in Framework Management technologies like Maven, Ant or Gradle
  • Experience in working with any one of the following Continuous Integration tools: Jenkins, Hudson, Team City, Bamboo, Anthillpro
  • Good to have some performance testing skills as well
  • Strong understanding of OOPs concepts
  • Must have strong views on Agile TDD/BDD
  • Must be a Good Team Player and be able to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be comfortable in working with any existing Test Automation Framework and be able to contribute towards it’s improvement

As Platform Architect, you will be actively managing standards and coaching our architects and engineering teams to modernize, deploy, operate, and maintain our edge data centres and hybrid cloud capabilities. This is a leadership and “hands on” role, you will draw from your deep and broad technical expertise to mentor coach and develop the skills and capabilities of our architects and engineers, completing hands-on technical work and resolving complex issues and challenges.

The identification of the resources needed for development and how this will be met with an effective supply capacity. Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Maersk is going through times of unprecedented change. From the farm to your refrigerator, the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other. Digitization and IT are taking centre stage in enabling our customers to trade globally, and we are building our core products in-house. Join the world’s leading container shipping company as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize trade. You will be joining an IT organization consisting of more than 4000 dedicated individuals. It is an outstanding opportunity for a career in a highly skilled global organization.

We Offer

You will be part of the Service Delivery Platform focused on streamlining and automating ocean container operations through advanced software solutions. Our software products are used by customers, Maersk’s operations front-line staff, and vendors assisting with Maersk’s operations across the globe. We aim to reduce manual processes to a minimum and let our Service Delivery products plan and execute operational decisions.

You will join one of our highly capable scrum teams in India and work closely with business and technology colleagues to build the digital backbone of our global container logistics business and optimize the flow of containers around the globe. As a Software Engineer, you will do hands-on software development in .NET Core/.NET 6, help guide the team’s technical direction, take part in architectural discussions, and actively engage with stakeholders from both business and technology to align expectations and remove roadblocks. Dedicated product owners will work with you to convert business needs into technology solutions. In addition, we employ dedicated user experience designers to work with you to test and validate our product designs early and often with customers and users. We believe in empowering teams and individuals to make the right technology choices, supported by architectural guardrails that align with Maersk’s technology strategy and cyber security practices.

We deliver high-quality, high-value software products to our business and customers. We invest in automating our build, test, and deployment processes as much as possible, as well as automated infrastructure provisioning and configuration to ensure that we can confidently release to production daily and recover from failures within minutes.

The Service Delivery Platform is built on modern micro-service-based architecture. We connect services through APIs and our Kafka event platform. We use .NET Core/.NET 6 for most of our services, supported by MS Azure services for authentication, data storage, caching, messaging, and serverless workloads. Our containerized workloads run on a central Maersk Kubernetes platform.

Our platform organization is geographically distributed, with engineering teams in Denmark (Copenhagen), India (mainly Bangalore and Pune), Spain (Algeciras). We offer work at Maersk’s offices in Bangalore and Pune but are also open for remote working. Our end users and stakeholders are situated all over the globe - you will be part of this international and diverse organization consisting of highly talented and motivated people from across the world. Our work culture is informal, with collaboration at its centre, and we believe that giving everyone a chance to be heard is the best way to achieve great results. Maersk Technology offers many exciting roles and industry-leading initiatives. Combined with our extensive professional training programs and communities of practice, we allow you to be in charge of your continuous professional and personal development. We offer flexible working hours, attractive compensation packages, including fully paid parental leave. We prefer working together in the office. However, we recognize that some people may prefer working from home.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop cloud-native, distributed systems in .NET Core/.NET 6
  • Ensure high quality and low cycle times through modern development practices and automation.
  • Drive features through to completion and take responsibility for the value we deliver.
  • Maintain infrastructure to develop, test, and run our products on MS Azure
  • Engage in discussion on technical design and architecture, both in your team and across Maersk’s Communities of Practice
  • Collaborate with product owners and user experience experts on converting business needs to solutions.
  • Support our product operations with instrumentation and monitoring and respond to incidents.

We are looking for

  • A software engineer with proven experience in a structured programming language. Experience with C#, and .NET Core/.NET 6 is a plus
  • A relevant university degree, preferably within software engineering or computer science
  • An understanding of software architecture and technical design.
  • A great team player and a strong collaborator.
  • Proficiency in English at a professional working level

In addition, the following experience is of value, but is not required:

  • Experience with building cloud-native, distributed systems. Experience with MS Azure is a plus.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
  • Knowledge of Domain Driven Design and/or functional programming.
  • Experience with microservices architecture.

As a performance-oriented company, we strive to always recruit the best person for the job - regardless of gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or religious beliefs. We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high performing teams.

Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
What we offer


The People Partner role is characterized by variety and you will gain a comprehensive understanding of the business in your designated geography. You will work in a dynamic environment, drawing on your broad HR toolbox to coach and support leaders through a time of great business transformation. Your daily job will be to engage with different stakeholders and use your wide breadth of HR knowledge to support leaders on a range of people matters and policies.

Joining Maersk, you will become part of the global family of the company that moves 20% of global trade everyday all the way, where one of our core values is Our Employees. It goes without saying that we value diversity: we thrive on the diversity of our talent in all its forms and we see it as a strength in building high-performance teams across brands, cultures and locations.

Key responsibilities

As we progress on our journey towards establishing a brand-agnostic people partnering model, you will play a key role. Initially you will be deeply involved in the preparation leading up to go-live and work on embedding the new ways of working, new HR processes and technology (Workday and ServiceNow), supporting leaders through the transition.

During 2022 your role will continue to evolve and your scope will change from implementation to steady state people partnering to include the below areas of responsibility:
 

  • Partner with the HRBPs on the implementation of the People Strategy.

  • To deliver on our service delivery model by working closely with HR professionals and specialists within our People Advisory, Centres of Excellence functions and Global Mobility teams.

  • Build strong relationships with leaders and their teams and be their main point of contact and sparring partner on all people matters.

  • Drive the local delivery of the annual HR Cycle, including annual performance management, compensation, succession planning and development.

  • Resolve employee relations issues, support and advise leaders on HR-related matters & policies.

  • Stay up to date with local employment law landscape to ensure local compliance.

  • Act as talent broker encouraging the transfer of individuals from one part of the organisation to another to obtain specific developmental experience.

  • Work effectively with the entire regional PPO team on day-to-day delivery of people processes as well as to resolve complex cases.

  • Draw people insights from available real-time reports to identify and address opportunities for improvement with leaders and local management.

  • Deliver trainings and workshops for local leadership teams and various employee populations on different HR topics.

  • Participate in on-site recruitment where needed and coordinate and perform employee activities required on site, i.e. onboarding, training sessions.

Who we are looking for

To succeed in this role, you should genuinely be a people’s person and thrive in an environment where no two days are alike.

As for the skillset and experience, we are looking for:
 

  • Solid experience (5-8 years) as an HR generalist and deep understanding of HR fundamentals, including recruitment, people performance management, employee engagement, compensation, development, employee relations.

  • Demonstrated passion for business through partnering with and supporting leaders to deliver on business results.

  • Advanced knowledge of local labor law; experience from working in unionized environments would be beneficial.

  • Experience in developing, safeguarding and interpreting HR policies and processes.

  • Acting as a trust advisor on a wide range of HR related matters.

  • Experience from large international organisations and the ability to build relationships and navigate a complex stakeholder matrix.

  • Good change management, facilitation and coaching skills.

  • Ability to take ownership and act autonomously, while also adopting a collaborative working style, fostering cooperation and teamwork to find solutions.

  • Flexibility and adaptability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment.

  • Resilience: the change process, is anything but straightforward; accepting uncertainty and demonstrating the ability to overcome challenges and deliver outcomes.

  • Be self-driven, energetic, and have a ‘can-do’ mindset.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and any local language.

You have been reading so far, we’re are glad to see you are interested. If you could see yourself in this role and are keen to be part of this journey at Maersk, we look forward to hearing from you!

Software Engineer – Terminal Data Onboarding


A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplify-ing trade to help our customers grow and thrive. With a dedicated team of over 80,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, A.P. Moller - Maersk is developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other.

The Maersk group operates one of the most comprehensive marine container terminals networks in the world, under the brand of APM Terminals, with over 20,000 employees operating 76 terminals in 36 countries and growing.

APM Terminals (APMT) plays a critical role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transhipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals, into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator.

We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our APM Terminals Terminal Integration Platform team - based in Bangalore (India)

We Offer
As part of this exciting growth, we have a vacancy for a Senior Software Engineer, with at least 5 years relational database experience.  There is a preference for cloud native design experience and for OpenSource technologies.  The successful candidate will be working as a key member of an agile team. You will be actively contributing to the development of business features for the organisation embracing frequent delivery, end-to-end solution ownership and lean/agile principles.
The expectation is for you to work closely with the data and present it in a way that is consumable and aligned to ‘operations and ‘commercial’ consumers.  We are looking for someone who is curious, inquisitive, and interested in being a key part of the solutioning of problem statements as part of the Agile team.
The role will involve contributing as part of a cross functional agile team in the design, development and testing of user stories while actively take part in sprint planning, backlog grooming and task estimation. It is expected that you will bring knowledge and a keen ‘thirst’ for further knowledge, as the role involves identifying and implementing leading-edge technology.

Being an exemplar of progressive development behaviours; maximizing collaboration and knowledge sharing through effective pairing on tasks with developers, testers, and DevOps the developer will also been responsible for the creation of POCs / Spike development and active involvement in technology evaluation.

•    Responsible for the quality design and implementation (supportable, maintainable, scalable, performant, secure, efficient, and supportable) of data driven applications delivering business value
•    Provide design validation on key technologies
•    Building complex queries with multiple table joins (up to 7 or 8) to deliver contextual APIs and Derived events to be used by multiple consumers
•    Supporting onboarding data from multiple terminals with different cultures and differing levels of technical debt
•    Take part in on-call rotations with the platform consumers (product development teams) and take the lead in prevent-ing incidents and maintaining platform SLAs, through automation and blameless postmortems.
•    Ensuring builds are kept green and the code management strategy (branching) is closely followed.
•    Raising capability and standards within team; pairing on tasks, peer review of team members’ code and constructive feedback for improvement in both the code base and team capability (blame free feedback etc.)
•    Proactive contribution to continual improvements within your team through both active participation in retrospective and from engagement with cross team best-practice communities

We are looking for candidates with a proven performance track record with the following:

•    You should exhibit knowledge of best practices in database management 
•    Maintaining and enhancing the performance of existing database programs.

Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Manager - Fraud Risk is a key part of the Fraud Risk Management team, a function set up by Maersk to assist and advise its businesses in managing the risk of fraud through various prevention and detection methodologies, as deemed necessary.

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify customers’ supply chains. As a global leader in container logistics services, the company employs approximately 100,000 people and operates in 130 countries. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.

With this larger scope of the business, comes various risks, key among them being the risk of Fraud. Towards this, Maersk has recently set up a Fraud Risk Management division focused on advising and assisting the various business units in its Group to minimise and manage the risk of Fraud.   

As part of the Fraud Risk Management team, every day is an exciting one with new challenges coming your way. Maersk gives you a real-life opportunity to see what it means when it comes to handling the various facets of fraud risk management viz. Prevention and Detection of frauds and work on them. As a Manager – Fraud Risk, you are likely to be involved in both facets of fraud risk management. This would entail, among others:

  • Participate in and contribute to building the repository of various opportunities for fraud prevention and detection
  • Apply your subject matter expertise to advise and assist management and business teams in identifying and assessing the risk of frauds applicable to them, followed by recommending and assisting in mitigating the risks identified.
  • Analyse outcomes of fraud investigations concluded to conduct root cause analysis and work with the management and other stakeholders to mitigate the risks identified.
  • Follow up with the local / global management and closely track the actions and action plans for closure of Fraud related issues
  • Maintain dashboards & quarterly communications to provide visibility to the local and global management
  • Prepare and maintain fraud risk registers basis through various sources including investigations, root cause redressals, business conversations, industry analysis among others to assist the business in arriving at a comprehensive view of the fraud risks applicable to them as well as helping them mitigate the risks as feasible.
  • Facilitate fraud vulnerability assessments in the relevant business areas where needed or requested to help identify the fraud risks and work with the management and other stakeholders to mitigate the risks identified.
  • Co-ordinate with the Management & GRC (Governance Risk Controls) teams to identify the impact /need for introduction of controls in respective areas/processes
  • Develop effective working relationships with senior business management to continuously monitor fraud related issues, ensure an understanding of control weaknesses, recommend control improvements, and create an awareness in resolving such issues.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of relevant regulations and law enforcement issues, fraud, criminal behaviour, and Group policies
  • Utilize the knowledge to provide direction and counsel to business management on the handling of complex issues and to facilitate issue resolution.
  • Contribute to quality improvement and the improvement of fraud risk management practices and policies.
  • Identify opportunities to detect frauds on a proactive basis, including predictive opportunities
  • Supervise / guide the building of dashboards to enable identification of frauds on a proactive basis in liaison with the analytics team in-house as well as external
  • Report investigable events by assessing exceptions identified through various fraud analytics’ exercises

With a dedicated team of over 80,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world. We offer

  • Code repositories and development lifecycle best practices with tools such as GitHub

  • A secure by design attitude – from TLS certificates, OAuth to industry CIS standards – you know how to engineer in security from the start, and then stay secure

Principal Software Engineer (Denmark/UK/Singapore/India)

We are currently looking for a Principal Software Engineer who could be based in Copenhagen - Denmark, Maidenhead - UK, Singapore, or India.

The Principal Software Engineer will report into the Vice President for the Logistics and Services Platform Portfolio Technology Leader. They are trusted by the company to ship complex software, self-direct in line with the company’s objectives, foster team spirit, offer platform-level impact, and increase technology awareness by participating in events and sharing useful content. Also, the Principal Engineer spends most of the time designing/documenting large-scale systems, writing reference code, improving processes, mentoring new senior engineers, providing advice, and setting the bar for quality.

In addition, the Principal Software Engineer facilitates internal discussions and inspires other engineers by directing their work to meet best-in-class and category standards. He or she, therefore, serves both as a role model and a mentor to every single member of the technical team. The right candidate will possess a unique combination of unparalleled dedication to the craft and a fervent desire to transform and improve the technology landscape.

The opportunity is not limited to working with exciting technology but to also solve complex problems, many of which are for the first time in the industry.

Further, you will play a leading role in transforming an over 100-year-old industry-leading company to be a technology-driven company.

Some key roles and responsibilities include:

  • The principal Engineer should understand the business strategy and align with the priorities, converting them to technological solutions with non-functional KPIs.

  • Refined knowledge and experience with Java, C#, .NET, Kotlin, JS, React, Typescript,

  • Cloud-native micro services, hybrid cloud environment preferably Azure and container technologies Kubernetes, Terraform, and Puppet

  • Database experience would be essential too, Dynamo and PostgreSQL

  • Flutter would be nice to have, but not essential

  • A principal engineer is responsible for the internal communication to rally people around the tech cause, enabling success at the executive and team level.

  • creates efficiency where it does not exist. He or she is expected to be 3 steps ahead of the company’s needs, providing solutions that improve efficiency/scalability for years to come.

  • is a force multiplier. They become an enabler for team through collaboration and technical solutions.

  • responsible for Depth as well as breadth. He or she is an expert in some areas and has good general knowledge about software engineering. It is not just about software development.

  • Dots the i’s and crosses the t’s. Beyond writing code, he or she leads by example and take care of the details.

  • Creates technology awareness. He or she is one of the key faces of engineering inside and out the company and enables awareness of the company while attracting talent and participating in tech conferences.

  • Drives engineering culture and craft he or she is an example of a craftsman and helps others to adopt the engineering culture and craft.

What gets you out of bed each morning: 

The Purpose that drives us: To improve life for all by integrating the world. “Our purpose is the reason why we get out of bed each morning – looking forward to a new and exciting day. It’s not about making money, but what we contribute to the world we all share. That means satisfying our customers, attracting and retaining great talent, and conducting ourselves as a responsible and valued member of our communities,” says CEO Soren Skou.

The purpose guides us in being at our best – and that, we imagine, you share with us.  

Working at Maersk 

At Maersk, we're building a culture where everyone can feel at home. We don't just work across continents, we work across different genders, generations, cultures, sexual orientations, religions, disabilities and perspectives. Together, we succeed as one global team. We want to encourage innovation and empower our teams to share new ways of thinking, making the most of our diverse talents. But it’s also about feeling involved and encouraged to be yourself.

About Maersk

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive.

We are a dedicated team of over 100,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world.

From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, A.P. Moller - Maersk is developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other.

We are rapidly developing technology products to integrate end-to-end logistics and deliver a reliable service to our customers. We are using cutting-edge technology and leveraging the power of AI and ML to make automated, and data-driven decisions.

No one better to explain our tech-driven transformation than the CEO of our Ocean and Logistics Business: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1VJm6KvHfC0

translate them into detailed functional requirements in the application
development process.

to the business.

Are you passionate about complex tasks that combine financial data, system implementation and product management? Are you excited about being part of a transformative journey with Finance & Accounting at Maersk? If so, we have an exciting position as Platform SME within the New Finance and Tax Platform (NFTP) Program, which is an important component of Maersk’s transformation strategy to become the Global Integrator of Container Logistics. This Program aims at changing technology, processes, policies, ways of working, as well as behaviors through the implementation of a single, industry-leading standardized platform. 

With NFTP, Maersk is building a solid technological foundation, with SAP S/4HANA at the core, to provide real-time, trustworthy Finance and Tax analytics through a standard and digitized model for data capturing, data reporting and data analytics in one enterprise-wide platform. 

We Offer

At Maersk, we promote a culture of honesty and integrity and value the trust we build with customers and employees alike. One of Maersk’s core values emphasizes on creating a motivating, diverse and inclusive environment where our people enjoy working together and having fun together.

The NFTP Management Reporting team is responsible for financial data, reporting, analytics and planning. We are also promoting new ways of working in the Finance organization by providing new tooling capabilities. The Platform Subject Matter Expert (SME) role offers you the opportunity to work as a product owner with new business processes and new technologies. You will have the responsibility to follow through the life cycle of a financial reporting product. You will have ample continuous learning opportunities in this role, from hard system skills to soft people skills. In addition, excellent organization exposures await you, because we have a large spectrum of stakeholders, ranging from Finance Execution, Finance Business Partner (FBP), Finance Planning & Analytics (FP&A) teams, to Platform Product Owner (PPO) teams and Program Management Office (PMO) teams.

You will be responsible for clarifying business requirements and translating them into new features for financial reporting. At this position, you will have access to the core financial systems of Maersk, develop deep understanding on how to generate published financial results, and become a master of the financial reporting of a global enterprise. Being part of the digitalization transformation process and learning the financial and business processes of all Maersk Ocean and Logistic products may also open up multiple career opportunities in the future.  

Key responsibilities

  • Track user statistics and collect user feedback. Study and analyze user behaviors.
  • Understand and discover business needs and conduct user impact analysis.
  • Drive requirement scoping with business and process owners, including requirement solicitation, clarification, prioritization, and documentation.
  • Facilitate engineers and architects to design and decide the right technical solution.
  • Collaborate with scrum master and engineers to drive on-time delivery, e.g., tracking status and managing risks.
  • Drive testing process with business users, including test case creation, test conduction and defect handling.
  • Support business users during go-live hyper care events, including but not limited to system training, release communication and issue resolution.
  • Act as the change agent and sparring partner for users and stakeholders.
  • Reflect and learn from past experiences.
  • Define, promote, and follow best practices

Education, Experience and Technical Skills:

  • Master’s degree in accounting/ finance or equivalent working experience
  • 8+ years hands-on working experience with SAP or S/4HANA
  • 8+ years data analytical experience
  • Reporting and dashboard visualization experience preferred (e.g., SAC, Power BI)

Description

Maersk is achieving an unprecedented transformation in the growth of our business, rethinking the way we engage with customers and partners, and how the world’s trade flows across our global network. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing solutions in-house that meet customer needs across the whole Supply Chain E2E. Joining Maersk you will join a global leader in Container Logistics as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize trade.
You’ll play a vital part in our success, helping us re-think what technology can do by using the latest technologies, and building the experience to advance your career. If you are passionate about working in an entrepreneurial environment supporting an ambitious, culturally diverse team of 3000 People within Maersk Technology – on a great transformation journey – then apply today!
 

The role of the Senior Software Engineer

As a Senior Software Engineer within our Telemetry team, you will be a driver and doer in a fundamental shift in how we measure applications and systems. Your focus will be to developing a solution to provide a single unifying telemetry system that any engineer at Maersk.

You will work to deliver features and enhancements to our telemetry systems. Collaborate with other team members to derive innovative solutions to complex problems. Strive to automate and eliminate alerts and bugs from our system that cause problems for our customers. Seek to run solutions in a cost optimized manner.

The team will also be responsible for aiding platform teams in the transition from varying different vendor solutions onto our unified telemetry system. This involves creating documentation and code examples that can be referenced in support channels, teaching sessions, or one on one meetings with engineering teams.

As a senior engineer, you will demonstrate the following characteristics: -

  • You are creative and come up with innovative approaches to projects and any issues that arise.
  • You are a “do’er”. You get things done.
  • Sharing expertise and insight with other engineers.

The ideal candidate will have a background that spans development and operations.   We are looking for software engineers with preference for staff with experience working in infrastructure, plus some ability across all areas; bracketed technology is desirable.

  • DevOps - Git (Github), Github Actions, Opensource CI/CD, Cloud CI/CD
  • Observability – Metrics, Logging, Tracing, Notifications
  • Backend – API, CLI, process orchestration/choreography, Golang, Java

Key Responsibilities

  • Contribute to the telemetry system to enhance the metrics, logging and tracing solution
  • Streamline internal operations through automation and programming solutions
  • Be an advocate for the platform by engaging with engineering teams to show best practices
  • Write clean concise documentation for internal and external audiences
  • Be a member of hiring panels

Key Skills

  • 8+ years of broad full-stack or backend engineering experience.
  • Provable proficiency in GoLang or Java programming.
  • Experience working in ReactJS, Flutter/Dart development with automated testing framework (cypress, selenium, etc).
  • Understanding of microservice based architectures and how to achieve composability.
  • Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and container technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes,  and GitOps Kubernetes operator.
  • Good working knowledge of time series databases, logging systems and tracing systems.
  • Experience deploying applications on Cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, etc.)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, supported by excellent written and oral communication

Proven leadership

  • Process understanding
  • Customer Orientation: Ensures Accountability; Agility: Plans and Aligns; Results Orientation: Action Orientation

Good communicator

With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Maersk is hiring a Lead Software Engineer to lead the development of our Visibility platform. The platform is responsible for answering the questions "where is my shipment?" and "when will I get it?" with a high level of accuracy and timeliness. This involves working with tons of data from multiple sources and helping surface the right levels of information to our customers, and helping them keep their supply chains efficient.

About the role

In this role, you will be playing a key part in building the foundations of an exciting greenfield project. Here are some of the things the role involves:

  • Work on defining event and API schemas in collaboration with parties that provide data to and consume from the platform.
  • Work closely with our product owners in translating ideas and solutions to customer problems into scalable working software.
  • Ensure application architecture and data flows are secure by design. Actively participate in architecture guilds reviewing work of other peer teams.
  • Break down high-level requirements, sometimes with ambiguity, into smaller specific items that can efficiently be worked upon by more junior engineers.
  • Make technology choices appropriate to the problem being solved; lay the foundations when a technology is introduced, and bring the whole team along the journey.
  • Ensure hygiene practices like clean code, test coverage, performance checks etc. are put in place and gated with automated checks.
  • Ensure applications emit standard signals needed for effective monitoring and alerting. Own the “running” of the application once deployed as much as “building” it encouraging DevOps mindset and skills within the team.
  • Actively participate in code reviews and encourage using it as a tool for the team members to learn from each other.
  • Partner with the engineering manager and drive a culture of continuous delivery where almost every single change goes to production on a continuous basis, and the path from code commit to going live is as automated as it can be.
  • Help create practices within the team that are inclusive of members working across geographies, time zones and cultures.

About you

Here are some things we expect from you for the role:

  • Be highly proficient with the JVM ecosystem, and have worked with Java or Kotlin for at least 5 years.
  • Be highly proficient working with containerised 12-factor apps, and tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Be highly proficient in building well-decoupled event-driven applications using a technology like Kafka.
  • Have prior experience working with serialisation systems like Avro or Protobuf.
  • Have prior experience working with at least one relational database and at least one NoSQL database.
  • Be familiar with observability concepts: logging, metrics, traces, alerts; and have experience using them in the past to run and maintain production applications.
  • Be familiar with methods and concepts in the field of cloud computing and can put them into practice; have experience in at least one of the following: Azure, Google Cloud, AWS. Knowledge of Terraform to create and maintain infrastructure in the cloud is a bonus.
  • Be effective at written and spoken communication. Also exhibit the same in writing code that can be well understood by other developers.
  • Having previous experience of working with realtime data at massive scale would be desirable.
  • Having knowledge about the logistics and supply chain domain would be a bonus.

Jobs.JobDescription:
Maersk is going through times of unprecedented transformation. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing path-breaking solutions that meet customer needs spanning the entire spectrum of the supply chain. Digitization and IT are taking center stage in enabling our customers to trade globally. 

Maersk is on multi-year program to revamp its technology and digital solutions platforms. As part of our strategy, SAP will act as the ‘digital core’ for the company’s major processes enabled by SAP’s latest S4HANA & SAP Cloud offerings. Maersk currently has two ECC based SAP finance solutions running our Ocean and Logistics & Services divisions. Our vision is to subsume these existing legacy SAP solutions into a single greenfield S4HANA implementation serving both our Ocean and Logistics & Services businesses. Join us as we re-think what technology can do for us.

As an SAP BRIM RAR expert, you will lead engagement with Order-To-Cash (OTC), Accounting-To-Reporting (ATR) and Revenue Accounting teams for assigned finance platform, partner with finance technology team to create a vision, translate team vision into roadmap and will be responsible for end to end deliveries of the team on best suited technical platforms in alignment with Maersk enterprise strategy. Maersk is operating in more than 130 countries across the world and with rapidly and constantly changing business and technology environment, RAR expert role offers an exciting opportunity to shape the vision and implementation of finance solutions across the Maersk group.

In this role, you will be part of the Maersk Technology team working with lines of business such as Ocean, logistics, services & terminals. You will be exposed to a wide and challenging range of business issues through regular engagement with key stakeholders across the world. In addition, being a part of Maersk will offer you the opportunity for career development in a global organization. 

Maersk is a highly international and inspiring environment with an attractive value proposition for its employees. As part of ensuring a successful work-life balance we promote flexible workhours and offer other benefits.

Technology delivery partner with Maersk RAR team focusing on integration with Order-To-Cash processes for Maersk Finance & Tax platform
•    Help create technology & solution vision in partnership with Finance OTC, ATR, RAR function and platform product owners
•    Translate the vision into roadmap and lead end to end deliveries in alignment within technology architecture framework
•    Build trusted advisor relationship with our business & technology stakeholders spanning the entire lifecycle of our digital transformation programs 
•    You will need to engage senior level business and technology stakeholders to anchor mature discussions related to end to end solutions encompassing business value, agility & robustness
•    Actively collaborate with platform product owners and lead Engineers to understand the impact on RAR and ensure accounting needs are delivered
•    You will own solution design, ensure it is developed and implemented by our inhouse SAP team working closely with external partners
•    You are a key enabler for other engineers, consultants and external partners in our business. You need to be able to demonstrate a customer service passion through professionalism and striving for excellence in all aspects of the customer engagement and experience
•    You may have to deliver hands-on SAP solutions and configuration for complex requirements in the planned S/4HANA solution
•    You will need to assist in managing the Product Backlog: including prioritization of user stories, creation of backlog items and mapping out dependencies in collaboration with business users and technology teams
•    You will need to anticipate business and customer needs; create and use customer journey maps and develop deep knowledge of the markets in which the product operates
•    You will work closely with overall development teams embracing Agile way of working; contribute to the planning, execution and review of each sprint and work with the team to refine and improve the development process.
•    You will be responsible to help evaluate product progress and be accountable the full lifecycle of the development process 
•    You will be responsible to improve the product performance metrics. These include value delivery, user satisfaction, performance of the support process, compliance, cost, stability of the product and deployment/roll-out performance.
•    You will be involved in contributing to developing product and agile practices for Maersk
•    Ensure governance is followed in change deployment, IT budgeting and manage relationship with vendors where relevant

You have:
•    Bachelor / Master's degree in Business or Finance or Chartered Accountant with minimum 10 years of experience with & should have managed Global Transformational projects with SAP BRIM & RAR in scope
•    Most recent experience in S/4 HANA Implementation as SAP BRIM Lead consultant and have multiple project experience in designing and implementing integrations to SAP RAR module
•    Expertise in the integration of SAP BRIM Convergent Invoicing & FICA with RAR 
•    Must have exposure to end to end solution of SAP BRIM & RAR covering - integrate sender components, perform and configure the inbound processing, configure and use Contract Management, perform a price allocation, process contract changes (prospective and retrospective), perform fulfillment and create invoices, integration with Cost Object Controlling, process revenue postings, reconciliation and consistency checks,  SAP Revenue Accounting and Reporting, configure and perform the migration and transition to SAP Revenue Accounting
•    Broad understanding of the IFRS15 standards and how the new SAP Revenue Accounting and Reporting (SAP RAR) solution has been designed to meet those standards.
•    Should facilitate the implementation and support of the SAP RAR solution to enhance the business functionality
•    Should analyze and define business requirements, processes and objectives to scope project and deliverables. Should have an experience in FI modules such as New GL/AR/AP/AA/Bank accounting
•    End to End process knowledge for upstream and downstream data modelling for IFRS 15 compliance, accounting processes and best practices
•    Knowledge of majority of new features related to HANA is needed embedded analytics using CDS views, user experience using Fiori, S/4HANA conversion and pre-requisites, S/4HANA simplification and technical impact, SAP cloud platform, usage of BRF+ in SAP S/4HANA.
•    Performs analysis of cross-functional and complex business requirements. Strong understanding of data management covering business and IT dimensions.
•    Experience with Agile combined with global delivery in a team spanning inhouse team as well as teams from external partners
•    Strong facilitation skills with ability to lead business and map the requirements into solution
•    Ability to lead and manage team of functional and technical experts
•    Excellent communications and presentation Skills
•    Ability to work in a very fast paced global scale S/4HANA implementation with ability to handle considerable ambiguity

Jobs.JobDescription:
Supports individual managers and functions with advice on HR Matters and
acts as point of entry to HR services for junior line managers.
Coordinates with centres of expertise.

Key responsibilities

As we progress on our journey towards establishing a brand-agnostic people partnering model, you will play a key role. Initially you will be deeply involved in the preparation leading up to go-live and work on embedding the new ways of working, new HR processes and technology (Workday and ServiceNow), supporting leaders through the transition. During 2021 your role will continue to evolve, and your scope will change from implementation to steady state people partnering to include the below areas of responsibility:  

  • Partner with the HRBPs on the implementation of the People Strategy.
  • Build strong relationships with leaders and their teams and be their main point of contact and sparring partner on all people matters
  • Drive the local delivery of the annual HR Cycle, including annual performance management, compensation, succession planning and development
  • Resolve employee relations issues, support and advise leaders on HR-related matters & policies
  • Stay up to date with local employment law landscape to ensure local compliance
  • Act as talent broker encouraging the transfer of individuals from one part of the organisation to another to obtain specific developmental experience.
  • Work effectively with the entire regional people team on day-to-day delivery of people processes as well as to resolve complex cases
  • Draw people insights from available real-time reports to identify and address opportunities for improvement with leaders and local management
  • Deliver trainings and workshops for local leadership teams and various employee populations on different HR topics
     

The role can be based in one of our key APAC locations
The People Partnering Organization is a truly international team where you will work alongside, learn from and build lasting relationships with colleagues from all over the world. About Us:

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company and member of the A.P. Moller Group. Connecting and simplifying trade to help our customers grow and thrive. With a dedicated team of over 1,00,000, operating in 130 countries; we go all the way to enable global trade for a growing world.

Build the platforms that are redefining global trade.

Join a global leader as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionise trade. You’ll play a vital part in our success and in this role you will be a key driver in building and rolling out our SAP TM Capabilities and Inland platform.

Maersk is on multi-year program to revamp its technology and digital solutions footprint and as part of new strategy, SAP will act as the ‘digital core’ for company’s Transportation Management processes.

While we are relying on varies Delivery partners in our transformation, we are investing into building our internal SAP TM capabilities.

As the Lead SAP TM Architect, you will be responsible for SAP TM architectural design across the platform, leading and managing the Senior Architecture team. Your role includes the solution design, delivery and support working closely with our Delivery Partners, product owner, architects and other stakeholders from business and technology. Our global template of SAP transportation management will be implemented by Maersk Delivery partners and SAP TM architect priority would be to establish Architectural principles and approach to enable implementation and roll of the standard template to different countries through 2022/3.

We offer

In this role, you will be part of the Inland Platform and Maersk Technology team. You will be exposed to a wide and challenging range of business issues through regular engagement with key stakeholders across the world. In addition, being a part of Maersk will offer you the opportunity for career development in a global organization.

Maersk is a highly international and inspiring environment with an attractive value proposition for its employees. As part of ensuring a successful work-life balance we promote flexible work-hours and offer attractive parental leave and other benefits.

Key responsibilities

• Responsible for Solution design for the SAP Transportation Management products across Maersk business units

• Proposing pragmatic design options and T-shirt sizing enabling priority discussion while keeping operational costs and architectural principles into account

• Work in both agile teams with SAP TM product owners, SAP developers/engineers and scrum master as well as in the Program organization closely engaging with Maersk Delivery Partners

• Ensuring no architecture bottlenecks impacting delivery of solution

• Quality assurance of the solution from design to delivery

• Compliance to Enterprise architecture guidelines and product roadmap

• Hands on solution design for the SAP TM products like Service Delivery, Procure to Pay, Order to Cash (relevant to TM).

• Managing the Product backlog, including prioritization of needs, creation of backlog items and mapping out dependencies in collaboration with users and customers

• Evaluating product progress accountable for each stage of the development process and the final product. Performance of product in general, includes example value delivery, user satisfaction, performance of the support process, compliance, cost, stability of the product and deployment/roll-out performance.

• To be successful, you need to perform stakeholder management related to your product(s)

• Contribute to developing product and agile practices across Maersk

We are looking for

You have:

• 15 years experience working as functional architect/product owner in agile delivery environments

• 7 Years successful commercial experience in SAP TM as architect.

• In depth domain knowledge in the Transportation Management and Logistics area.

• Experience in implementing large and complex SAP Projects, and designing architecture to meet business requirements.

• Experience in shipper and LSP processes while designing and implementing Rail and Road scenarios

• Experience in working with Planning, Optimization, Execution, Procure to Pay and Order to cash business process/activity owners for Transportation Management and understanding of business requirement and solution design

• Experience in developing SAP roadmap for Transportation management and SAP Inland Platform

• Experience with S/4HANA implementation is a must

• Experience of working with SAP MM, SD integration with SAP FI/CO and SAP EM

• Technical knowledge of BOBF, ABAP and integration with other SAP components and integration experience with legacy systems

• Experience in working with Agile, Scrum and waterfall delivery models

• Good problem solving & communication skills

• Bachelor's Degree in IT related discipline

• Collaborative mindset across business functions

Jobs.About_Us: A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customer's supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, the company operates in 130 countries and employs roughly 70,000 people. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.
Jobs.JobDescription:
Maersk is hiring a Senior Engineering Manager to lead the development of our Visibility platform. The platform is responsible for answering the questions "where is my shipment?" and "when will I get it?" with a high level of accuracy and timeliness. This involves working with tons of data from multiple sources and helping surface the right levels of information to our customers, and helping them keep their supply chains efficient.

About the role

In this role, you will be playing a key part in building a team to work on an exciting greenfield project. You will help create a team of programmers, and conditions for them to iteratively ship features as we carve out new solutions to age-old problems.

Here's some of the things the role involves:

- Formally manage 1-2 scrum teams, be involved in providing the technical direction, and remove impediments from the path of the team to ship features continuously.

- Have regular 1:1 with the team and ensure the engagement is high. Be fully invested in developing a team of well-rounded programmers by encouraging individual ownership, continuous learning, and sharing of knowledge.

- Help create practices within the team that are inclusive of members working across geographies, time zones and cultures.

- Work closely with our product owners to ensure work is sliced and lined up in a way that we can ship value to our users fast and learn; so if we do fail, we fail fast.

- Work with stakeholders to remove impediments and protect the team from any organizational bureaucracy​​​​​​​.

- Drive a culture of CI/CD where almost every single change goes to production on a continuous basis, and the path from code commit to going live is as automated as it can be.

- Make pragmatic decisions with the team about speed and quality by clearly articulating the trade-offs involved.

About you

Here's some things we expect from you for the role:

- Be a humble servant leader who thrives in the success of the team.

- Be familiar with the overall management of the workforce including aspects of acquiring people, including employees, consultants and contractors.

- Have had a successful career as a programmer, and reasonable recent experience as an engineering manager.

- Be familiar with methods and concepts in the field of cloud computing and can put them into practice; have experience in at least one of the following: Azure, Google Cloud, AWS.

- Be familiar with practices for writing applications that can scale well horizontally and are maintainable as team members evolve. This includes things like 12-factor, domain-driven design, practical test pyramid.

- Be familiar with the Java (or JVM) ecosystem and database concepts; familiarity with technologies like Kafka and Kubernetes is a bonus.

- Having previous experience of working with realtime data at massive scale would be desirable.
